PURPOSE OF POSITION:
Industrial Electrician will be responsible for the maintenance, troubleshooting and repair of equipment used in the operation of the production facility.


POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Inspects all electrical equipment in the plant, checking motor bearings, lubrication, commutation, excessive vibration, obvious signs of wear or need for adjustment, etc. When faulty operation is observed or pointed out by operating crews, diagnose trouble using testing equipment or own judgment based on general knowledge of electrical principles
Determines the best way of making repairs to minimize interruption of production
Receives instructions, wiring diagrams, specifications, etc., covering the scheduled and emergency repair, installation and inspection work to be done
Program and troubleshoot variable frequency drives (VFDs)
Repair/maintain/troubleshoot motor controls, temperature sensors and safety sensors
Carry out oral/printed work requests and apply corrective action
Program, troubleshoot, maintain and repair industrial equipment and automation including PLCs, HMI, frequency drives, temperature control and other related devices
Maintain current equipment with preventive maintenance measures
Operates small machine tools, such as drill press, power saw, etc
Install conduit, fittings, switches, controls, fixtures, and connect and adjust electrical equipment for new installation or replacement of facilities, etc
Use computers for diagnostics in troubleshooting electronic equipment, downloading event logs, and other various functions
Maintain, troubleshoot and repair electronic digital communications control systems, combined electronic fire alarm and smoke control systems, electronic door security controls, , intercom and paging systems, fans, pumps and their motor control equipment, digital card reader systems, parking gates and roll-up doors, motion sensors, door monitoring systems, power distribution systems including but not limited to lighting distribution and low voltage switching, power distribution panels and circuits, emergency generator and related heating, ventilating and air conditioning (HVAC) equipment and power transfer switches


 
POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

Inter-Provincial Red seal in the industrial electrician trade
Must have experience working with voltages ranging from 24V to 575V, 3 phase
Knowledge of electrical instruments and test equipment
Skill in repairing, troubleshooting and maintaining electrical systems and equipment. Skill in reading blueprints and schematics
Skill in using a variety of hand and power tools, multi-meters and diagnostic equipment. Skill in written/verbal communications
Skill in using computer software such as Microsoft Outlook, Excel and Word
Previous industrial / manufacturing operations / automation systems experience is considered an asset
Must comply with company safety policies including the use of company approved PPE personal protective equipment (steel toe work boots, hearing protection, safety glasses, work gloves, hard hat & other)
CPKC operates 7 days a week, 24 hours a day, 365 days a year; must be able to work on various shifts and days off

POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Executes Finance systems processes in SAP BPC/SAC (Financial Planning and Consolidations) to support month-end close, and annual budget and monthly forecasting activities including ETL (extract, transform and load) activities, maintaining and building specific reporting templates, financial master data maintenance, running system scripts, etc.

Provides system related advisory and troubleshooting support, and develops creative solutions for implementation including analysis of business requirements

Contributes to the department's program to ensure Finance users can effectively and efficiently use the various systems available to Finance, including providing guidance, workshops and creating training content

Seeks to expand areas of subject matter expertise and shares knowledge with colleagues and other Finance/IS teams

Undergraduate degree in Commerce, Accounting, Finance, or other relevant fields (designated or pursuing CPA designation is preferred)
Minimum of 4 years of experience in financial or operations accounting, financial planning and/or supporting Finance using SAP BPC and SAP SAC or similar applications
Advanced knowledge of Excel (pivot tables, advanced formulas, formatting, macros, modelling)
Demonstrated experience or training with BI tools such as Power BI, Excel VBA, Qlik, SAP S4 HANA or similar experience including system implementations
Effective relationship builder with superior customer service and communication skills (both verbal and written)
Demonstrated experience executing continual process improvements
Demonstrated intellectual curiosity to identify root causes and ability to work collaboratively toward a common solution able to work collaboratively with multiple stakeholders including Finance and Information Services
Applies critical thinking and creativity to find unique solutions to complex issues
Self-motivated, self-starter who can work independently and take initiative to drive change with limited oversight
Strong attention to detail, time management, and organizational skills
Able to provide guidance and training to end user groups of disparate skill and knowledge levels

He/She will operate in an assigned geographic territory, traveling to customer locations, growing existing accounts and developing new busines, mainly working from a home office environment.
 Responsibilities

 Effectively execute the Nokian Tyres sales strategy; retaining and growing existing accounts as well as developing new business.
 Build a strong and trusting relationship with our customers in territory during regular site visits and sales calls.
 Continually develop and maintain sales activity with key regional dealers.
 Engage customers through superior product and service offerings as well as demonstrated product expertise.
 Within the assigned territory, manage the launch process for new products and services.
 Participate in marketing and product knowledge events such as seminars and trade shows.
 Utilizing CRM tools, market analysis and other intelligence; monitor territory sales progress and adapt approaches to optimize sales effectiveness.
 Resolve operational and administrative issues, respond to internal and external inquiries, and prepare routine and special reports as required by management.
 Uphold Nokian mission and values, and demonstrate supporting behaviors in day-to-day actions.
 Other duties as assigned.

 Requirements

 University degree from an accredited institution of higher learning.
 10+ years outside sales experience, preferably within the tire or automotive industry.
 Demonstrated analytical, decision making, and problem-solving skills.
 Strong interpersonal and communication skills; able to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
 Excellent listening, consultation, negotiation and presentation abilities.
 Proficient with MS-Office application suite and Salesforce / CRM applications.
 Ability to travel 75% within the assigned region, by air or car.
 Must possess a valid driver’s license.
 Must be authorized to travel to the U.S. for occasional sales meetings.
 Prior Tire industry experience
 Proven track record of building and maintain strong relationships.
 Strong in Public Speaking.

Il/Elle opèrera sur un territoire géographique assigné, se rendra chez les clients, chez les concessionnaires et les flottes, et travaillera principalement à partir d'un environnement de bureau à domicile.
 Responsabilités

 Exécuter efficacement la stratégie commerciale de Nokian Tyres ; conserver et développer les comptes existants ainsi que développer de nouvelles affaires.
 Construire une relation solide et de confiance avec nos clients sur le territoire lors de visites régulières sur site et d'appels commerciaux.
 Développer et maintenir continuellement l'activité de vente avec les principaux concessionnaires régionaux.
 Engagez les clients grâce à des offres de produits et de services de qualité supérieure ainsi qu'à une expertise produit démontrée.
 Sur le territoire assigné, gérer le processus de lancement de nouveaux produits et services.
 Participer à des événements de marketing et de connaissance des produits tels que des séminaires et des salons professionnels.
 Utiliser des outils CRM, des analyses de marché et d'autres renseignements ; suivre les progrès des ventes sur le territoire et adapter les approches pour optimiser l'efficacité des ventes.
 Résoudre les problèmes opérationnels et administratifs, répondre aux demandes de renseignements internes et externes et préparer les rapports de routine et spéciaux requis par la direction.
 Défendre la mission et les valeurs de Nokian et démontrer des comportements de soutien dans les actions quotidiennes.
 Autres tâches assignées .

 Exigences

 Diplôme universitaire d’un établissement d’enseignement supérieur accrédité.
 Plus de 10 ans d'expérience en vente externe, de préférence dans l'industrie du pneu ou de l'automobile.
 Compétences démontrées en matière d’analyse, de prise de décision et de résolution de problèmes.
 Fortes compétences interpersonnelles et en communication; capable de travailler en collaboration au sein d’équipes interfonctionnelles.
 Excellentes capacités d’écoute, de consultation, de négociation et de présentation.
 Maîtrise de la suite d'applications MS-Office et des applications Salesforce/CRM.
 Possibilité de voyager à 75 % dans la région assignée, en avion ou en voiture.
 Doit posséder un permis de conduire valide.
 Doit être autorisé à voyager aux États-Unis pour des réunions de vente occasionnelles.
 Expérience préalable dans l'industrie du pneu
 Expérience avérée dans l’établissement et le maintien de relations solides.
 Fort en prise de parole en public.

 Avantages:

 Plan d'incitation à la vente
 Plan de retraite
 Véhicule de société (par exemple, Ford Explorer)
 Congés payés
 Congé parental payé
 Aide à l'éducation
 Rabais sur les pneus pour les employés
 Allocation de travail à distance
 Allocation d'installation de bureau à distance
 Remboursement du gymnase

 Nokian Tyres est un employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances et prend des décisions en matière d'emploi sans égard à la race, à la couleur, à la religion, au sexe, à l'orientation sexuelle, à l'identité de genre, à l'origine nationale, au statut d'ancien combattant protégé, au statut de handicap ou à tout autre statut protégé par la loi.

Join us in creating the technology that helps the world act together


   Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.
 

   We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.
 

The team you’ll be part of


   Cloud and Network Services (CNS)
   As Nokia's growth engine, we create value for communication service providers and enterprise customers by leading the transition to cloud-native software and as-a-service delivery models. Our inclusive team of dreamers, doers and disruptors push the limits from impossible to possible.
 

   The CNS organization has defined a special solution architecture role, called Solution Consultant. This role requires excellent and broad knowledge of the entire CNS portfolio, expertise in T-Mobile’s networks and excellent communications skills to match.
 

   The person in this role will become a trusted advisor to the sales team and the customer in order to drive strategic solution strategies for break-in opportunities and to lead solution definition of offers that are tailored to meeting customer’s needs and winning new business. An innate curiosity of the customer’s environment and needs, a desire to solve their problems with a solution mind-set and a good knowledge of the CNS portfolio capabilities will be required to drive solution thought leadership with the sales team and customer with the ultimate goal of growing the business
 

What you will learn and contribute to


   As part of our team, you will:
 

Be responsible for driving Innovation engagements in AT&T
Engage with executives in AT&T and Nokia to identify innovation opportunities based on Value created for AT&T and Nokia
Lead a multi-domain team of experts of Nokia to deliver innovation material demonstrating the business value of the solutions
Deliver POCs and Demos demonstrating the value proposition and preparing transfer to a funded engagement
Report regular feedback and progress to AT&T and Nokia Executives
Become the Innovation face of Nokia inside AT&T through demonstration of thought leadership
Drive breakthrough net new sales through Innovation




 Your skills and experience
 You will have:
 

At least 10 years in Telecommunications with experience in a customer facing roles like Solution Architect, Technical Sales Engineer, etc.
Bachelor’s degree In Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or similar degree or equivalent professional experience.
Excellent presentation skills to present to CxO level management, senior management as well as intermediate management levels expecting more technical content
The candidate needs to have demonstrated that they have created a trusted relationship with a customer. This is a key requirement for this role.
Deep understanding of the Telecom industry techincal shifts and impacts on the business of all actors
Demonstrated leadership through innovation and forward thinking


   It would be nice if you also had:
 

Knowledge in many or most of the following:

Cloud (OpenStack, Containers, Mobile Edge Computing),
OSS/BSS applications (analytics, service assurance, orchestration, etc),
5G (network slicing, policy/payment, orchestration, security, analytics, etc),

Device management (eSIMs, IoT, customer care, etc),
Element management (NetAct and EdenNet SON),
Software development technologies (cloud native, telecommunications open source projects, commons software foundation, CI/CD, devops tool chains), and IMS (VoLTE, SBC, SDM).




What we offer


   Nokia offers flexible and hybrid working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.
 



 Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer


   Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:
 

One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
Workplace Pride Global Benchmark
LGBT+ equality & best place to work by HRC Foundation




   At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people.
 

   Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
   We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.
 

   Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

   Position Purpose
   Reporting to the Director, Research and Program Support, the incumbent assists with and performs a variety of tasks to support the administrative operations of a department, specific program or event, while ensuring compliance with applicable policies and procedures.
 


   In this role, your responsibilities will include:
 

 Administrative Tasks: Performs a variety of administrative tasks to support the operations of the department/program/event, such as entering and updating data, drafting and preparing a variety of documents, and managing schedules and mail, in keeping with uOttawa quality standards.
 Customer Service: Welcomes people who arrive in person; responds appropriately to general requests for information from customers and guides them in applying the general internal procedures of the department/program/event with a view to providing high quality service. Requests for information may be received and handled in person, by email, by phone or by mail.
 Records Management: Implements and maintains an effective filing and records management system to preserve confidentiality of the records and ensure that complete and accurate documentation is available for future reference or audit purposes. Maintains accurate records of key holders and related security access information for staff of the sector to ensure confidentiality of the records.
 Documentation: Drafts and updates documents for internal use on procedures, processes and systems related to the incumbent’s responsibilities.



   What you will bring:
 

 Postsecondary education in administration and office technology, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.
 Minimum two (2) years of demonstrated experience in a similar role.
 Experience with computer systems and applications such as Windows, word processing software, spreadsheets, databases, the internet and email.
 Excellent communication, interpersonal and customer service skills.
 Experience interpreting, explaining and applying policies and regulations.
 Experience in bilingual administrative writing.
 Experience producing reports.
 Ability to produce high quality work under pressure while meeting strict deadlines.
 Initiative, self-reliance and good judgment.
 Strong organizational skills.
 Bilingualism – English and French (spoken and written).



   Key Competencies at uOttawa:
   Here are the required competencies for all or our employees at uOttawa:
  
 Planning: Organize in time a series of actions or events in order to realize an objective or a project. Plan and organize own work and priorities in regular daily activities.
   Initiative: Demonstrate creativity and initiative to suggest improvements and encourage positive results. Is proactive and self-starting. Show availability and willingness to go above and beyond whenever it is possible.
   Client Service Orientation: Help or serve others to meet their needs. This implies anticipating and identifying the needs of internal and external clients and finding solutions on how to meet them.
   Teamwork and Cooperation: Cooperate and work well with other members of the team to reach common goal(s). Accept and give constructive feedback. Able to adjust own behaviour to reach the goals of the team.

Position: Deployment Specialist (Contract with Potential for Extension)
Are you a customer-centric individual with a passion for providing top-notch service? Join our team as a Deployment Specialist on a contract basis, with the potential for an extension if you excel in your role. You'll have the opportunity to make a difference in the wireless industry by ensuring a positive customer experience at client locations.
Responsibilities:

On-Site Assistance: Your day-to-day tasks will involve working directly with customers at various client locations. You will handle tasks such as SIM swaps, data transfers, and addressing customer inquiries promptly and effectively.
Customer Engagement: Building strong customer relationships is key. You will engage with customers, addressing their needs, providing solutions, and creating a lasting positive impression.
Multi-Site Work: As part of this role, you may work at multiple client sites in a single day. Adaptability and the ability to thrive in different environments are essential.
Service Excellence: You will be a vital part of ensuring customers receive the best-in-class service. Your dedication will help instill and reinforce confidence in Imagine Wireless as a premier wireless provider.

Qualifications:

Strong Customer Focus: A deep commitment to customer satisfaction and a passion for providing exceptional service.
Communication Skills: Effective communication is a must, both in addressing customer inquiries and working with the team to resolve issues.
Technical Proficiency: Basic technical knowledge, especially in SIM swaps and data transfers, is a plus. Training will be provided if necessary.
Adaptability: The ability to switch between different client sites seamlessly and maintain a high level of performance is crucial.
Team Player: Collaboration with colleagues, both on-site and off-site, is essential to ensure a consistent customer experience.

Join our dynamic team as a Deployment Specialist and help us elevate the wireless service industry by delivering unparalleled customer service. Your role is instrumental in shaping Imagine Wireless as a trusted wireless provider, and if your performance is outstanding, there is the potential for an extension of your contract.

Senior Project Engineer
Who we are:
Enginuity Consulting Ltd., a multi-disciplinary engineering consulting firm located in South Burnaby, is looking for a motivated Project Engineer with at least 5 years of experience and is looking for a long-term career in consulting within the Industrial Engineering field in clients’ facilities ranging from Food Manufacturing, Clean-Tech, Pharmaceutical, Pulp and Paper, Ports and Terminals, and Mining. For more information, please visit our website at www.enginuity-consulting.ca.
Salary: $110,000.00-$140,000.00 per year
Reasons you'd want to work with us:
⨠ Wonderful opportunity to work in a growing team of multi-disciplinary engineering professionals delivering exciting industrial engineering projects to a wide range of industry leading clients such as STEMCELL Technologies, Seaspan, Vancouver Port Authority, Molson's, Rogers Sugar and more.
⨠ See projects through various stages from infancy to design, execution, and satisfaction to see the commissioning and operation of your work.
⨠ Enjoy a professional environment focused on working together in a collaborative, purpose driven and values-based way. At Enginuity we believe in treating each other with respect and living our values of:

Professionalism
Own It
Critical Thinking
Resourceful
Caring About People and Relationships
Passionate to Learn

What we are looking for:
We are looking for a passionate and experienced individual to join Enginuity as a full-time Project Consultant, a key member of our Project Delivery Team. The successful candidate will come with an engineering, consulting, or EPCM background, having experience in industrial construction, operational, and maintenance projects from engineering and design through to construction. You come with experience managing resources and direct reports, and delegating assignments of tasks and deliverables within the consulting and professional services environment. You are a highly motivated self-starter who consistently demonstrates professionalism, and a desire to grow both professionally and personally. You are a team player who enjoys what you do, leading with a positive attitude towards clients, team members, and our partners, while striving for constant improvement in process and delivery.
What the role is all about:
The Project Consultant is a core member at the top of the Project Delivery team, focusing on overall client satisfaction through successful project planning initiatives, being the key point of contact for clients, and ensuring the successful delivery of projects. The role is a hybrid of Project Management, along with technical consultation of clients and internal resources for delivery. The role will start off as in-office during the onboarding and training period and will transition to Enginuity’s Hybrid Work Policy. At Enginuity, we aim to promote a healthy and rewarding work environment, by offering unique benefits that enable you to balance your personal life while achieving a rewarding and fulfilling career.
What you'll get to do every day:

Management of engineering and project life cycle
Planning of scope & service delivery
Management of Internal resources, clients, and other stakeholders to ensure successful project progression and delivery
Proactive quality control and risk management
Resource planning with respect to dynamic project needs and development
Selection, definition, and estimation of additional scopes and services required to meet project objectives
Technical Project Consultation
Project & Business Development Support
Leadership of internal resources

What we need from you:

Must have a P. Eng with 5 years experience and be eligible to practice in BC
Relevant and proven industry knowledge and experience within engineering Consulting or EPC Services with a solid understanding and experience in supervising and collaborating with Mechanical, Structural, Civil, and Electrical engineers
Understanding project life cycles from the concept and feasibility phases, through to construction for industrial facilities – with a background in codes, standards, and protocols. Post-secondary education is required, with a preference in Mechanical Engineering or another relevant field
Must be in good standing with EGBC as a Professional Engineer, and be able to maintain relevant professional accreditation
Minimum 5 years of industry experience with a strong focus on managing and directing resources, design coordination during the engineering phase, stakeholder management, and mentorship of juniors
Must have experience working in a similar capacity/role, in a consulting, EPCM, or engineering services environment
Must be fluent in English (native or bilingual), have highly effective written and oral communication and presentation skills, and ability to communicate effectively with clients, contractors, trades personnel, engineers, etc., and to resolve situations requiring immediate judgment
Must have a passion for learning and understanding new industries and projects
An inquisitive, clear thinker who can determine what work is required and can draw rational conclusions from the information available
Carry a Class 5 driver's license and own a vehicle
Must be legally eligible to work in Canada

What you'll get from us:

Hybrid Environment (Work Monday, Friday, plus one other day in the office, and two days from home)
3 weeks' vacation to start with 5 paid sick days, ability to Bank Time and have extra time off drawn down from the Banked Time earned
Competitive compensation and Annual Performance Reviews
Discretionary bonus based on performance and organizational results
Excellent Benefits Plan including LTD
RRSP Matching Contribution Program
$2,000.00 Annual Professional Development budget
Employee Referral program - if we hire someone you refer, you earn a bonus (once they pass probation)
Internal Training and Mentoring programs, and learning resources dedicated to your career growth
Company funded staff events, teambuilding, office snacks and espresso machine
Free onsite parking

Do you have an outgoing personality, play well with others and have the drive to succeed? Saskatoon-based Red Wireless is Manitoba’s and Saskatchewan’s exclusive Rogers retailer, and we want to hear from you.
Thousands of Rogers customers make Red Wireless their home for wireless solutions. We have recently opened a remote contact centre that allows you to work from home anywhere in Canada. We are looking to staff up quickly and provide support for our customers. Many more would like to, and that’s where you come in.
You’re a well-spoken, confident communicator that consistently makes a good first impression. Patience is a core quality of who you are. You engage potential customers in dialogue that opens opportunities. You thrive in an environment that does not feature a lot of top-down direction. You have the ability to process orders quickly and accurately while clearly presenting our products and solutions when engaging customers by telephone.
We fully support our team by ensuring they have the tools to get the job done right through an onboarding program with an experienced coach. At Red Wireless, we are proactively dedicated to assisting you in reaching your career goals.
SUMMARY OF POSITION
Work remotely and speak with potential and existing customers across the country from our dedicated database. You will use your skilled telephone demeanour and friendly personality to ensure an outstanding call experience in every case. You will establish and manage relationships over the phone in a timely manner such that clients are instilled with confidence in your abilities and Red Wireless as a wireless provider.
HERE’S WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR IN A CANDIDATE

Previous experience in retail or telephone sales.
Ability to provide a space that is quiet where you can be focused on the customer as this is a remote position.
Excellent telephone etiquette.
Fluent in English language; bilingual a plus.
Strong interpersonal and organizational skills complemented by keen strategic problem-solving.
Great customer communication with the ability to adapt to clients’ needs.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office.
Strong technical aptitude (capacity to learn new systems) and a passion for technology.
Basic knowledge of the Rogers suite of products and services; telecommunications sales experience is an asset.
Dedicated to providing customers with outstanding service, take pride in your work, and go the extra mile to ensure a quality result.
Above all, you are driven, goal orientated and organized!

KEY JOB FUNCTIONS

Act as a Rogers Ambassador by professionally representing the organization in accordance with its value standards.
Build, establish, and grow customer relationships with new and existing customers on the telephone.
Drive sales opportunities throughout all lines of business within our database.
Leverage and incorporate all marketing tools available for sales opportunities, including media, websites and print materials.
Develop and maintain an expert knowledge level of Rogers products, services, promotions, and policies.
Actively participate in Rogers software and process training and coaching sessions, as required.
Successfully achieve customer satisfaction metrics and sales targets for products, accessories, value packs, device protection and Apple Care.
Maintain a maximum 24-hour turnaround time for all customer requests during regular business hours.
Utilize internal systems and programs (e.g., Pipedrive, Front, Vonage, and Slack) to effectively manage order details and efficiency.

WE OFFER AN ATTRACTIVE PACKAGE

Competitive compensation.
A proven sales process and training program with the support you need to succeed.
Opportunities for advancement and career growth.
A fun, dynamic team.
Benefits package after three months.
A working environment with personality.

A position with Red Wireless supporting Rogers customers is an excellent opportunity to apply your knowledge and experience in a rewarding setting alongside a fun team. This is certainly a position and working environment where you will get out of it what you put into the experience. Do you have the drive and commitment that it takes to succeed here? If so, we can’t wait to hear from you!

Job Description:
Fleming is located in the heart of the Kawartha Lakes Region in Central Ontario, Traditional Mississauga Anishinaabe Territory and covered by the Williams Treaties,1923... a beautiful place to live and work, surrounded by natural beauty and a mere 90 minutes north-east of Toronto. The College’s 6,800 full-time and 10,000 part-time students, including hundreds of international students from countries around the world, attend at campus locations in Peterborough, Lindsay, Haliburton and Cobourg. Fleming offers more than 100 full-time programs in Environmental and Natural Resource Sciences, Fine Arts, General Arts and Science, Technology, Skilled Trades, Community Development, Health, Business, and Justice as well as other Continuing Education courses.
 We are also extremely proud of our more than 85,000 Fleming alumni who are contributing to their communities in the region, across the province and around the world.





 What Are We About?





Working with the International Student Services (ISS) team, the International Student Advisor (ISA) focuses on enhancing the service experience of international students and ensuring effective supports are in place, contributing to the retention and success of international students. 
This position is responsible for researching, planning, implementing, communicating, and evaluating international student programming and services to support international students’ transition to Fleming College and integration into the community. 
The ISA works with the ISS team to coordinate and implement International Student Orientation, Arrival Services, international student receptions and cultural celebrations, immigration workshops and information sessions, field trips, and other identified programming within ISS. 
The ISA is responsible for advising and supporting international students and staff on issues of concern such as matters of immigration, health insurance, academic progression, and cultural and social integration.
 The ISA has lead responsibility for planning/coordinating activities such as Arrival Services, virtual and in-person International Student Orientation, Peer Mentoring and Welcome Receptions.
 Please note: this position is designation as on-campus 100% of the time.
 For More Information: For a complete job description, please refer to the document found here: Job Description Explore what Fleming College has to offer and the beautiful communities we are surrounded by. Check out Life@Fleming.
 What We Are Looking For:

Completion of a 3-year diploma/degree in Business Administration, Community Development, Education, Student Development, Recreation, Social Work, Sociology or International Studies 


Regulated International Student Immigration Advisor (RISIA) or Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultant (RCIC
Minimum of three (3) years of recent, practical, related working experience including:


Working in international education, particularly in international student support. 
Formal knowledge of and certification in current Canadian immigration processes including Immigration, Refugees, and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) legislation, policies and procedures pertaining to international students 
Advising international students regarding immigration & settlement with proven ability to troubleshoot, analyze and solve problems to meet customer needs 
Excellent customer service skills with empathy and patience to effectively deal with anxious and frustrated students. 
Working in a multi-cultural setting with strong skills related to cultural sensitivity including excellent human relation skills with the ability to relate to students from a variety of social, academic, economic and cultural backgrounds
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) with the ability to convey complicated information in a manner which is understood 
Demonstrated ability to exercise diplomacy and tact in resolving conflict 
Strong presentation skills and experience in the development and delivery of immigration and cultural competency workshops 
Demonstrated, relevant event/non-academic program planning experience including promotion and advertising. 
Working independently, in a team environment, organizing, prioritizing and problem-solving own work, handling multiple tasks and timelines from a variety of sources in order to meet deadlines. 
Ability to effectively allocate tasks to student employees, volunteers
Dealing with sensitive and confidential information referring to CICC, IRCC, and College policies and the FOI Act.
Membership in good standing with the College of Immigration and Citizenship Consultants (CICC) as a Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultant or a Regulated International Student Immigration Advisor (RCIC/RISIA)
Proficiency using word processing, spreadsheet, email and internet applications


 Please Note – Support 
Internal candidates will receive first consideration in accordance with our Full Time Support Staff Collective Agreement. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Thank you for your interest in joining the Fleming College family.
 How To Apply Internal Candidates can apply by going here: My Self Service > Recruiting > Careers or My Campus > Career Opportunities External candidate can apply by visiting our website: http://www.FlemingCollege.ca/Careers.

Why work for Lafarge?:
 

 As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a 
  greener, 
  smarter and 
  healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., 
  safety comes first, 
  collaboration matters and 
  diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually 
  make our materials better.



 Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?
 

 Overview:
 

 Our operation consists of selling aggregate material to customers for construction projects.
 


 Working as a team member, the Weighmaster/Loader Operator is in the field and helps coordinate the day-to-day
   activities at sites where shipping is taking place; Actively promotes safety and enforces site rules with contractors,
   drivers, visitors and customers; Provides excellent customer service by engaging employees and visitors in a
   professional and friendly manner; Acts as key person in communicating with and receiving feedback from drivers and
   contractors on topics of safety, logistics and customer service; Operates mobile equipment to load customer vehicles
   with aggregate in accordance with Lafarge’s Best Practices and Policies; Operates weigh scales and front-end
   systems according to Lafarge policies and assists in various administration tasks as directed by management team.
 

 The weighmaster/loader operator may also be assisting the Portable Crushing team with stockpiling material,
   transporting material, and clean up around the work area.
 

 The weighmaster/loader operator is responsible for the safe and efficient operation and maintenance of the loader,
   which will consist of preventative maintenance before and after each shift for the day. Preventative maintenance may
   include, but not limited to greasing, cleaning the machine, and conducting thorough inspection. All work is to be
   completed according to Lafarge’s Best Practices and Policies. 
 Responsibilities:
 

 Safety: 


Promote safety culture through engagement with employees, subcontractors and suppliers, implementation and maintenance of local and regional initiatives with an objective of “zero” safety incidents.
 Administer and promote safety policies, processes and review procedures to ensure that site meets or exceeds all Lafarge and Regulatory guidelines.
 Ensure the yard and surrounding site is kept safe, presentable, and functional.


 Environmental Management: 


Ensure that site meets or exceeds all Lafarge and Regulatory guidelines. Report and manage environmental spills to site management as they occur. Operate equipment effectively to minimize carbon footprint of machinery.


 Equipment:


 Ensure assigned equipment is operated and maintained to original equipment manufacturer specifications and industry best practices.


 Maintenance: 


Perform daily inspections as part of our preventative maintenance program to ensure equipment is properly maintained. Perform preventative maintenance tasks to minimize the amount of downtime incurred during shipping (i.e. greasing).


 Other:


 Perform other duties as assigned to assist in the efficient operation of the site. Perform general housekeeping tasks to ensure the site is presentable.


 Relationships with Others Jobs:


 Reports to the Depot Supervisor


 Specific Accountabilities:


 Safety: Near Miss and HI process, MVA’s, FA’s, MI’s, LTI’s, Daily Safety Huddles, Risk Assessments, Confined Space and WAH permits
 Maintenance: daily, weekly, monthly, and annual inspection process, prioritize deficiencies as they occur
 Logistics: operates APEX system, follows SOP for taring, weighing, ticketing & data entry, open and close site(s) daily
 Qualifications:
 

 Education & Work Experience:


 Canadian secondary school diploma or equivalent
 Industrial plant operation experience an asset
 Heavy equipment operation experience an asset
 Valid “G” license


 Knowledge & Skills:


 Specific mobile equipment training
 Mechanical aptitude
 Administrative adeptness
 Organization
 LafargeHolcim:
 

 As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are 
  passionate, driven by 
  curiosity and keen to 
  grow, 
  learn, develop and 
  thrive in our high-performance culture.
 

   Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

Position: Student, Resource Conservation - Rouge National Urban Park
Job Description:
Parks Canada 
    Markham (Ontario), Scarborough (Ontario) 
    SU-01 
    Salary to be determined at the time of the hire and is based on the current academic level of the student and previous work history with the Government of Canada. (https://www.canada.ca/en/treasury-board-secretariat/services/pay/rates-pay/student-rates-pay.html) 
   

     Rouge National Urban Park 
    

     Experience Canada by joining the Parks Canada Agency! 
    

Closing date: 3 January 2024 - 23:59, Pacific Time 
Who can apply: Students enrolled in a recognized post-secondary institution in a program related to environmental and/or natural sciences (e.g. biology, ecology, geology). 
   
 To be considered, you must be registered as a student in a recognized institution (prior to employment) and be less than 30 years of age. Proof of student status will be required.
   
 Parks Canada Agency considers applications from students who have legal status to work in Canada. Please indicate in your application the reason for which you are entitled to work in Canada: Canadian Citizenship, permanent resident status, or work permit.
   
 Preference may be given to candidates who self-identify as Indigenous, visible minorities or persons with disabilities. As such, we encourage you to self-identify in your application. 
   Apply online


Important messages
We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request specialized accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
 Assessment accommodation
We will only accept on-line applications received via the GC Jobs website. Persons who are unable to apply on-line must contact the person listed below prior to the closing date.  LOCATION OF WORK AND HOUSING Students are responsible for their own transportation to and from the location of work. The work location does not have transit accessibility and is located at 7277 14th Avenue Markham, Ontario L6B 1A8.   ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS *** NOTE: When submitting your application to this selection process, you will be required to answer screening questions to demonstrate how you meet the Essential Qualifications (Education and all Essential Experiences).  Applicants must clearly demonstrate how they meet the Education and Experience factors listed in the Essential Qualifications when responding to the questions in the on-line application. Applicants must clearly demonstrate how they meet these factors by providing concrete examples with significant details to explain WHEN, WHERE and HOW you meet each factor. Please note that it is not sufficient to only state that these factors are met or to provide a listing of current or past responsibilities. Resumes will be used as a secondary source to validate the experience described when responding to the questions in the on-line application.  Failure to clearly demonstrate how you meet the Education and Experience factors when responding to the questions in the on-line application may result in the rejection of your application.
Duties

Conduct field work in one or more of the following work areas: ecological integrity, species at risk, ecological restoration, environmental impact assessment, tree health and risk assessments, invasive species monitoring/mitigation, road ecology, and human wildlife conflict response and monitoring.
Collect biological and environmental data and/or samples during aquatic and terrestrial surveys.
Manage databases and conduct basic data analysis under the guidance of park staff.
Complete literature reviews and/or lead the development, implementation, execution, and presentation of research projects under the direction of park staff.
Support the creation of Impact Assessments, Best Management Practices and/or other policy related documents that forward the Species at Risk Action Plan for Rouge National Urban Park.
Monitor and respond to basic human-wildlife coexistence situations and perform basic wildlife husbandry when needed under the supervision of a wildlife rehabilitator and other park staff.
Participate in public events and/or volunteer initiatives as required.

Work environment
 Parks Canada is a federal government agency responsible for the protection and preservation of Canada’s outstanding natural and cultural resources through a system of national parks, national marine conservation areas and national historic sites in all regions of Canada.  A rich assembly of natural, cultural and agricultural landscapes, Rouge National Urban Park is home to amazing biodiversity, some of the last remaining working farms in the Greater Toronto Area, Carolinian ecosystems, Toronto’s only campground, amazing hiking opportunities, and human history dating back over 10,000 years, including some of Canada's oldest known Indigenous sites.  Rouge National Urban Park is one of the largest and best protected urban parks of its kind in the world, spanning 79.1 square kilometres in the heart of Canada's largest and most diverse metropolitan area, overlapping the cities of Toronto, Markham and Pickering and the townships of Uxbridge and Whitchurch-Stouffville.  Rouge National Urban Park is a new type of protected area in the Parks Canada family – a national urban park. While it shares many of the characteristics of other protected areas, the park has been specifically created because of its urban setting and its mix of natural, cultural and agricultural resources and landscapes. Approximately 20 percent of the Canadian population lives within a one hour’s drive from the park.
Intent of the process
The intent of this process is to hire for full-time (37.5 hours/week) positions from May to August 2024. There is also the potential for a part-time contract extension from September to November 2024. 
Positions to be filled: Number to be determined 
Information you must provide
Your résumé.
A list of the courses you have taken as well as any courses that you are taking now, or that you will be taking this academic year
In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)

A current post-secondary student in an accredited institution in a program related to environmental and/or natural sciences (e.g. biology, ecology, environmental science/studies).

 Degree equivalency

Experience conducting field work or research with an environmental and/or natural sciences focus (Note: experience can be acquired through traditional knowledge and land-based learning as well as post-secondary education).
Experience organizing and entering collected data.

 If you possess any of the following, your application must also clearly explain how you meet it (other qualifications)

Experience organizing and preparing equipment for aquatic and terrestrial based field work.
Experience with species identification and abundance estimation (e.g., point counts, marsh monitoring program, tree health and risk assessments, vegetation sampling protocol) for ecological projects related to the assessment of flora and/or fauna.
Experience implementing monitoring protocols to consistently collect replicable data and enter that data efficiently, among a wide variety of research topics.
Experience handling wildlife for research, collection and/or conservation purposes.

 The following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)
 English essential
 Information on language requirements

Knowledge of Parks Canada, Rouge National Urban Park and the Greater Toronto Area.
Teamwork – Works collaboratively with others, readily shares information, knowledge and personal strengths, and seeks to understand the perspective of others to achieve common goals.
Decision Making – Making decisions involving various levels of risk and ambiguity.
Concern for Safety – Identifying hazardous or potentially hazardous situations and taking appropriate action to maintain a safe environment for self and others (follows the health and safety guidelines). 
Endurance – Walking up to 6 hours daily, covering 10 kilometers across all types of terrain while carrying equipment in a backpack or in hand.
Exercises sound judgement
Communicates effectively
Demonstrates integrity
Personally connects with people

 The following may be applied / assessed at a later date (may be needed for the job)

Knowledge of Species at Risk found in Rouge National Urban Park as well as the related monitoring methods and management practices.
Knowledge of impact assessment, pre- and post-construction monitoring and environmental surveillance.
Knowledge of tree biology and forest ecology to assist with tree risk assessment activities, mitigation efforts, and tree seed collection.
Ability to understand, document, monitor and report human-wildlife coexistence situations and implement mitigation methods to address public concerns.


   Willing and able to:
  

Wear a Parks Canada uniform, abide by uniform policy and wear proper safety equipment.
Work and/or travel off roads and paths, with limited communication and emergency response capacity, in various meteorological and environmental conditions (e.g. cold, hot, rain, biting insects, noxious weeds, uneven terrain).
Work irregular hours, and/or weekends and/or statutory holidays and/or provincial/territorial holidays.
Lift and carry a minimum of 25lbs (approximately 9kg) over short distances.
Wear a backpack with a maximum weight of 25 lbs.

Position: Bilingual (French/English) Customer Care Advisor (Contact Centre) - Ottawa, January
Job Description:
Requisition ID: 188443  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Looking for a hybrid role? We have the job for you! We want you to join our team and have the ability to work the way you want! Hybrid means we are flexible on where you work during the week. You will be required to come into the office for a minimum amount of time and certain requirements will need to be in place – read more to find out.

 Who we are:
 The Scotiabank Customer Contact Centre team is at the heart of our operations. Our Canadian Banking Contact Centres (CBCCs) are based out of six locations in Canada, Mexico, Colombia, and Dominican Republic. Our key guiding purpose, For every future, articulates why we do what we do. Our all-inclusive culture empowers our employees to make decisions that are best suited for their careers. Together, we make a difference by harnessing the limitless potential that diversity offers. Company Description
  Work with Us. Change the World.
 At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations.
 There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of nearly 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world.
 We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us.



 Job Description
 
 

 The Water Division of AECOM is actively seeking an Intermediate Water Resources Engineer for full-time employment. This position can be based out of any of our Ontario locations (for example Markham, Kitchener, Mississauga, Whitby).
 The appropriately qualified candidate will have an opportunity to contribute to a wide variety of interesting water resources projects that include water resources planning, watershed and stormwater management and modelling, environmental assessments, hydrology, hydraulics, stream rehabilitation/natural channel design, flood risk assessments, highway drainage systems, in-field assessment, and monitoring. Skills you will likely use or develop in this job include project coordination, hydraulic and hydrologic modelling, water quality and quantity monitoring, data analysis, and report/proposal writing all in a friendly, fast-paced consulting engineering work environment at AECOM. This role offers upwards career progression within AECOM for motivated candidates with the right aptitude and work ethic.
 The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

 Developing technical engineered solutions for surface water projects including water supply planning and management, alternatives analysis, hydraulic calculations, flood mitigation, etc.
 Performing streamflow analyses, water resources modeling, watershed planning, stormwater management, preparing planning documents, etc.
 Producing design calculations, plans, models, estimates, specifications, and technical reports, and developing drawings and visual aids for water and wastewater infrastructure.
 Designing surface water management infrastructure from feasibility level to construction documentation including detailed design, tender documentation
 Coordinating and supporting project execution including communicating with clients, meetings, completing technical analysis and reviews, preparing reports and proposals, conceptual/preliminary and detailed designs of surface water infrastructure.
 Exercising judgment relating to developing work details in making preliminary selections and adaptations of engineering alternatives.
 Working directly with the group manager, project engineers, hydrologists, fluvial geomorphologists, ecologists, junior and support staff on projects related to Water Resources, mostly within Ontario.





 Qualifications
  Minimum Requirements:

 Bachelor’s degree in Water Resources or Civil Engineering + 2 years of relevant experience.
 Experience or working knowledge of the following software packages: AutoCAD, ArcGIS, HEC-RAS, Visual OTTHYMO, HEC-HMS, PCSWMM, InfoWorks, etc.
 Experience in proposal preparation including determining work scope, preparing time task breakdowns, and preparing text sections on technical approach, team and project experience, etc.
 Interested and capable to take on project management duties (schedule and budget control, client contact, proposal writing etc.) as assigned.

 Preferred qualifications:

 5+ years of experience in water resources
 Master’s degree in Water Resources
 Ability to learn quickly, communicate effectively and work with others is essential
 Strong computer skills including advanced working knowledge of ArcGIS, Civil3D, Word and Excel
 Excellent organizational, communication and writing skills

 Additional Information
 

 Sponsorship for Canadian employment authorization is not available for this position.
 Offered rate of compensation will be based on individual education, qualifications, experience, and work location. The salary range for this position typically is $65,000 - $85,000.


 About AECOM
 AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. Our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm and its Professional Services business had revenue of $13.1 billion in fiscal year 2022. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM.

 Freedom to Grow in a World of Opportunity
 You will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.
 You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.
 AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.
 Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.
 All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Our goal is to be a diverse workforce that is representative, at all job levels. The Halifax Port Authority welcomes applications from Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, veterans and persons of all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientations, and gender identities and expressions. We also welcome applications from non-Canadians who are eligible to work in Canada. If you are a member of one of the above groups, you are encouraged to self-identify, on your cover letter, or resumé.
 The Port of Halifax is about making connections between people, commerce and opportunity. We take a leadership role in developing business for the Port of Halifax in collaboration with our partners and we responsibly manage Port of Halifax assets.
 In 2022, the total impact of the Port of Halifax including Nova Scotia exporters on the Province of Nova Scotia was $4.87 billion in economic output with the direct portion being $3 billion. This level of activity generated direct and spin-off positive impacts of $2.5 billion in GDP, $1.6 billion in labour income and over 25,300 jobs. Offering a natural, deep harbour and big ship infrastructure, Halifax can accommodate large volumes of containerized cargo, bulk cargo, and project cargo. Collaborating and working with strong partners and stakeholders, the Port community in Halifax continues to deliver excellence.
 HPA Guiding Principles
 Everyone at Halifax Port Authority is expected to carry out their work in a manner consistent with our guiding principles:

 Be One Port City
 Collaborative & Engaged
 Future Focused
 Sustainable
 Trusted Partner

 We believe that when everyone works in this way, we can achieve our mission and vision and can deliver value to our customers, our community and our team.
 At this time, the Halifax Port Authority ("HPA") requires
 Administrative Assistant, the PIER
 This position reports to the Executive Director, The PIER. The Administrative Assistant, The PIER works with the Executive Director and the team at the PIER to support administration and office management, as well as contributing to member services, activities, and events. This position also acts as the first point of contact for members, staff, the reception desk at the PIER, supports information management activities, assists in coordinating the PIER's finances, and works with the Communications & Programming Coordinator to support member activities and events.
 ACCOUNTABILITIES Administration

 Ensures that The PIER supplies are kept in stock.
 Works from the reception desk, greets guests as they enter, accepts, or picks up deliveries from HPA offices, and ensures appropriate guest access.
 Works with the Executive Director and HPA Finance to coordinate hub finances, including tracking expenses and processing invoices and purchase orders and provides regular budget reports.
 Supports other administrative functions of The PIER, including keeping minutes from meetings of the Steering Committees and managing information for The PIER.
 Processes incoming mail and electronic correspondence, including member mail, actions as required, and distributes accordingly.

 Member Services

 Supports Member Services, including but not limited to:
    
 Acts as a first point of contact for members as problems arise.
 Liaises with members of The PIER team to address concerns.
 Proactively engages with members to identify problems and/or areas for improvement.
 Actively listens to members and identifies needs in a proactive manner.
 Works with members and theMember Services Coordinatorto support events and activities taking place in The PIER.
 Arranges member orientations including liaising with OH&S for safety orientations.
 Maintains the PIER contact information.
 Supports the set up new members, physically and virtually.

 Ensures that issues that are brought forward are dealt with in order of priority by HPA staff.
 Works with the Communications and Programming Coordinator and Member Services Coordinator to support event and activities at The PIER, including:
    
 Booking venues.
 Working with members, or the PIER team, to organize event logistics.
 Arranging catering with members.
 Planning PIER events and/or HPA events held in The PIER.
 Works after hours as required to support events.

 Assists with supporting member engagement in digital platforms.
 Works with the Communications & Programming Coordinator to coordinate content for the Digital Wall.
 Works with the Executive Director, Communications and Programming Coordinator and Members Services Coordinator to support activities and events.

 Other

 Coordinates andleads special internal PIER projects onbehalf of the Executive Director, The PIER frequently involving internal and external stakeholders.
 Assists other HPA departments, as required, depending on HPA priorities and requirements for administrative support.

 NOTE: These are only the basic and primary duties; related and allied duties may be assigned from time to time as may become necessary to the operation of the Authority
 EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE

 Successful completion of Grade 12 with an administrative diploma from a recognized post- secondary administrative program.
 Minimum five (5) years' experience in an administrative position or 3 years of experience with any post-secondary education.
 A working knowledge of Microsoft office suite and knowledge of other systems, i.e., CRM, MRI, Purchase Order system, etc., would be considered an asset.
 Must have the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with internal staff as well as various levels of stakeholders.
 Must have excellent time management skills, be able to prioritize workload, and be able to work in a fast-paced environment.
 Capability and readiness to work under pressure, either imposed by deadlines for document preparation or emergency situations and must be flexible.

 WORKING CONDITIONS
 Normal office environment. Flexible hours or overtime may be required for The PIER operations, events, and activities.
