Associate Tenant Researcher
Job Description
Job Description Company Intro CoStar Group (NASDAQ: CSGP) is a leading global provider of commercial and residential real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Included in the S&P 500 Index and the NASDAQ 100, CoStar Group is on a mission to digitize the world’s real estate, empowering all people to discover properties, insights and connections that improve their businesses and lives. We have been living and breathing the world of real estate information and online marketplaces for over 35 years, giving us the perspective to create truly unique and valuable offerings to our customers. We’ve continually refined, transformed and perfected our approach to our business, creating a language that has become standard in our industry, for our customers, and even our competitors. We continue that effort today and are always working to improve and drive innovation. This is how we deliver for our customers, our employees, and investors. By equipping the brightest minds with the best resources available, we provide an invaluable edge in real estate. CoStar CoStar is the global leader in commercial real estate information, analytics and news. Commercial Real Estate industry professionals around the globe use CoStar to access the most comprehensive data to make decisions with confidence. CoStar delivers immediate, verified commercial real estate information on over 5.9 million properties across every market. Learn more about CoStar. OVERVIEW CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence. The Marketing Research team is the heart of CoStar, capturing market-critical information that enables our commercial real estate clients to make informed, high impact business decisions daily. CoStar Group’s research contributes to the most important segment of our economy, helping businesses open offices, retail stores, warehouses, and manufacturing facilities. CoStar Group is seeking an Associate Tenant Researcher to join our growing research organization. As an Associate Tenant Researcher, you will be investigating and profiling companies to help owners, brokers and real estate professionals identify which companies are best suited for their buildings. RESPONSIBILITIES Investigate and profile commercial tenants occupying commercial spaces in a geographical market Conduct 2+ hours of phone interviews each day with the tenants, owners and real estate professionals occupying or managing commercial spaces Conduct web research to create comprehensive profiles on commercial tenants and business decision makers Document tenant movement within a geographical market Maintain complete and accurate Tenant rosters for various commercial buildings Investigate new property and tenant leads Document and profile corporate structures BASIC QUALIFICATIONS Bachelors Degree required from an accredited, not for profit University or College A track record of commitment to prior employers 8+ months experience in a customer service environment Flexibility to work shifts aligned with ET, CT, MT, and PT time zones Permanent Canadian work authorization Legally able to travel to and enter the United States for business purposes PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS: Ability to connect with people quickly and professionally over the phone Proven success performing to metrics or key performance indicators (KPI) Natural curiosity, persistence, and ability to conduct thorough investigative research Experience and demonstrated proficiency with Excel that includes the ability to manipulate data, filter, and develop basic formulas. All qualified candidates will be given an assessment to determine their knowledge of Microsoft Excel 2016 Capability to accurately capture and enter data Ability to manage multiple responsibilities, changing priorities, and excel in a fast-paced environment Self-motivated and goal-oriented What’s in it for you? When you join CoStar Group, you’ll experience a collaborative and innovative culture working alongside the best and brightest to empower our people and customers to succeed. We offer you generous compensation and performance-based incentives. CoStar Group also invests in your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program. Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to): We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply. However, please note that CoStar Group is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position. Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug Life, legal, and supplementary insurance Commuter and parking benefits Registered Retirement Savings Plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement Discounted fitness center membership costs (location dependent), and group exercise classes. Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks Be part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it - see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group:

Position: Consultant Associate, Impact Assessment and Permitting (Entry Level)
Job Description:
Environmental Resources Management (ERM) is a leading global provider of environmental, health, safety, risk, and social consulting services. We are currently seeking an outstanding Environmental Assessment and/or Permitting Consultant to join our Canadian regulatory and permitting team. This position would ideally be based in one of our Canadian offices (e.g., Vancouver, Smithers, Whitehorse, Calgary, Saskatoon, Toronto), but would allow for flexibility and remote work from other locations. Applicants in other locations in Canada will also be considered.
 


   The role requires experience in the infrastructure or natural resource development sector—particularly in the renewable energy, transportation, oil and gas, or mining sectors—combined with a demonstrated understanding of applicable provincial/territorial and federal regulatory and permitting requirements. The successful candidate will join ERM Canada’s regulatory and permitting team and will be connected with ERM’s global team of environmental and social experts.
 


   This posting is designed for a resourceful, motivated person with experience and skills in environmental assessment and/or permitting, who enjoys problem-solving and leading teams within a challenging and fast-paced multi-stakeholder environment.
 


   RESPONSIBILITIES:
 

 Provide input on a variety of regulatory, permitting, and environmental impact assessment tasks in support of clients’ projects.
 Work on multiple projects alongside project managers to support project delivery to meet client’s expectations and meet quality standards on project deliverables.
 Support engagement activities with communities and stakeholders as part of the project design and permitting process.
 Support project delivery activities such as permit application scoping, application information requirements, technical writing, data and regulatory research and review, collection and integration of input from ERM’s subject matter experts, permit and environmental management plans, delegating work to GIS, data compilation and desk-top publishing assignments to support permit applications and development of recommendations for clients.


 Build strong collaborative relationships with other ERM employees worldwide.
 Contributing to business development and marketing activities in the company through conducting research on client needs, preparing marketing materials, and participating in proposal preparation.
 Thinking critically and strategically, helping to influence the impact of our work and the outcomes for our clients.



   QUALIFICATIONS & DESIRABLE SKILLS:
 

 Bachelor’s degree in environmental sciences, environmental engineering, or related field.
 1 to 2 years of experience (academic or industry) in the environmental or sustainability field.
 Understanding of environmental and social effects related to mining, oil and gas, renewable energy, transportation, and/or related developments.
 Prior experience in environmental consulting, industry or government is an asset.
 Awareness of Canadian federal, provincial and territorial regulations and guidelines (in particular, environmental assessment and permitting processes in British Columbia, Alberta, Ontario, Yukon, Northwest Territories and/or Nunavut) or similar legislation in other jurisdictions.
 Interest in project management, including deliverable and budget tracking, and client communications.
 Ability to both work as part of a team and be a self-starter when required.
 Excellent writing, communication, organization, attention to detail, and time management skills.
 Proficiency with Microsoft Office and project management tools such as schedules, and budget tracking.
 Ability to prioritize and meet deadlines in a demanding work environment.
 English is required, and fluency in multiple languages (e.g. Indigenous languages, French) is an asset.
 Strong commitment to safety, including following established health and safety protocols.
 Strong commitment to diversity, equity and inclusiveness in the workplace.
 Excellent analytical and critical thinking capability, able to collect and synthesize large amounts of information and discern what is important
 Demonstrate a growth mindset and keen interest and ability to learn new skills and knowledge, applying and integrating on an ongoing basis
 Collaborate naturally, are dependable and flexible
 Demonstrate a positive, confident approach when working with others



 For the 
Consultant Associate, Impact Assessment and Permitting 
position, we anticipate the annual base pay of 
$63,058 – $68,781 CAD
. An employee’s pay position within this range will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, performance, shift, travel requirements, sales or revenue-based metrics, and business or organizational needs. 
We also may have instances where compensation may be outside of the range, based on the factors noted above
. This job is also eligible for an annual discretionary based performance bonus.



 We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, paid parental leave, medical, dental, vision, life, disability and AD&D insurance, 401(k) or RRSP/DPSP, and any other benefits to eligible employees as applicable.


 You can apply for this role through 
https://www.erm.com/careers/apply/
 or through the internal careers portal if you are a current employee.



 Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, or any other form of compensation that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.



 Who We Are:


   As the largest global pure play sustainability consultancy, we partner with the world’s leading organizations, creating innovative solutions to sustainability challenges and unlocking commercial opportunities that meet the needs of today while preserving opportunity for future generations.
 

   At ERM we know that creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive work environment is an essential part of making our company a great place to build a career. We also see our diversity as a strength that helps us create better solutions for our clients. Our diverse team of world-class experts supports clients across the breadth of their organizations to operationalize sustainability, underpinned by our deep technical expertise in addressing their environmental, health, safety, risk and social issues. We call this capability our “boots to boardroom” approach for its comprehensive service model that allows ERM to develop strategic and technical solutions that advance objectives on the ground or at the executive level.
 


   Please submit your resume and brief cover letter. Based on review of these responses, shortlisted candidates will be invited for interviews.
 


   ERM does not accept recruiting agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, ERM employees or any other company location. ERM is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
 


   ERM is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
 


   Thank you for your interest in ERM!

Position: Director, Mineral Science and Processing Division
Job Description:
Natural Resources Canada - Lands and Minerals Sector 
    Ottawa (Ontario) 
    EN-ENG-06 
    $133,058 to $154,474 
   Closing date: 8 December 2023 - 23:59, Pacific Time 
Who can apply: Persons residing in Canada, and Canadian citizens and Permanent residents abroad. 
   Apply online


Important messages
We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request specialized accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
 Assessment accommodation
The Government of Canada is committed to building a skilled workforce that is representative of Canada's diversity, which includes the recruitment of Canadian Veterans and releasing Canadian Armed Forces personnel: https://www.canada.ca/en/public-servicecommission/jobs/services/publicservice-jobs/canadian-armed-forcesmembers-veterans.html  We encourage applicants to identify any abilities, competencies, and/or experiences acquired through employment with the Canadian Armed Forces where applicable.
Work environment
 At Natural Resources Canada, a Federal government job means developing leadership skills, fostering teamwork, and supporting creativity and innovation. We know it takes people from diverse pools of talent to make this happen. That is why we are looking for people like you. As an employee at Natural Resources Canada you can enjoy diverse employment opportunities, a range of career development programs, and a learning culture that supports you to learn on an ongoing basis. We support balancing your work and private life by offering the benefits of flexible work arrangements.
Intent of the process
The intent of this selection process is to staff a full-time indeterminate position.  A pool of partially qualified candidates may be established through this process to staff with identical or similar positions within Natural Resources Canada with various tenures, various language requirements (English Essential, French Essential, English or French Essential, or Bilingual), linguistic requirements (imperative and/or non-imperative) and profile(s) (BBB/BBB, CBC/CBC, CCC/CCC, etc.), various security requirements (Reliability status or Secret clearance), various conditions of employment and for various locations. 
Positions to be filled: 1 
Information you must provide
Your résumé.
In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)
 Education Graduation with a degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in mining engineering, civil engineering, mechanical engineering or some other engineering specialty relevant to the duties of the position.
 Degree equivalency

   Experience
  

Experience in managing a multi-disciplinary team of engineers, scientists and administrative professionals in the delivery of R&D programs related to mineralogy, mineral processing and extractive metallurgy related to critical minerals and other commodities.
Experience in building partnerships and use of networks from either public or private sectors to deliver on R&D and innovation priorities.
Experience in setting strategic directions and planning of R&D projects and initiatives to meet expected deliverables and outcomes.
Experience in working collaboratively with international allied countries to Canada to deliver on projects related to the development and production of critical minerals.
Experience managing finance and human resources including recruitment, coaching, mentoring and performance management.
Experience in leading the development and delivery of collaborative R&D projects.
Experience in providing strategic advice and recommendations to senior management.



   Knowledge
  

Knowledge of the Green Mining Innovation program at Natural Resources Canada.
Knowledge of the R&D priorities of the CanmetMINING branch within Natural Resources Canada.
Knowledge of the Canadian Critical Mineral Strategy and the Canadian Minerals and Metals Plan.
Knowledge of the Critical Minerals Research and Development and Demonstration Program at Natural Resources Canada. 
Knowledge of the challenges facing the mining industry to meet it’s emissions targets by 2050.
Knowledge of emerging technology trends related to mineral Science and processing applicable to the mining industry in Canada.
Knowledge of policies and regulations related to mineral science and processing for the mining industry in Canada.



   Competencies
  

Create vision and strategy 
Mobilize people
Uphold integrity and respect
Collaborate with partners and stakeholders
Promote innovation and guide change
Achieve results


 If you possess any of the following, your application must also clearly explain how you meet it (other qualifications)

   Operational Requirements:
  

The position requires in-person presence at the 555 Booth facilities at least 3 days a week.
National and international travels are required to meet objectives of the program.

Human Resources Generalist - Silvertip Resort Opportunity

Job Description:
Posting End Date:
  December 10, 2023
 

   Employee Type:
  Regular-Full time
 

   Union/Non:
  This is a non-union position
 

   At Enbridge, we embrace new ideas and offer an environment where employees are recognized and respected for their input and opinions. We view our employees as our future leaders and strive to provide an environment that encourages self-improvement, innovation and growth so that we can promote from within. We are looking for outstanding employees who share our vision to be the best in everything we do, from safe and reliable operations to innovative solutions and complete team commitment and dedication to our values!
 


   Enbridge is seeking a Gas Controller to join our outstanding team!
 


   This role is a key member of the Enbridge Gas Control Centre and is responsible for the safe, reliable operations of natural gas storage, transmission and distribution systems.
 


   Do you have experience in a control room environment or in field operations? Have you worked with industrial controls (natural gas industry) or automated systems? We want you to apply today!
 


   What You Will Do
 

 Complete a comprehensive in-house, hands-on training program as set out within the Control Centre, Enbridge Gas, that prepares you to achieve your Gas Controller certification.
 Monitor and control gas storage, transmission and distribution systems through a real time automated system (SCADA).
 Maintain system capacities and contractual obligations through system hydraulic evaluations and monitoring and controlling of gas supply/demand.
 Respond to abnormal and emergency conditions including recognition, response, emergency process initiation/participation and reporting.
 Build and maintain excellent customer service and working relationships with interconnecting pipeline control centres; other internal local control centres; field personnel; customers; and internal scheduling groups.
 Forecast and adjust market supply requirements.
 Perform periodic project work supporting the Control Centre as may be included in the shift schedule.
 Additionally, to all the above specified Accountabilities for a Controller II Position, this person is required to be working as an OQ qualified Gas Controller II for 3 years.
 Take on an active role of the “Utility Controller” Position which includes a non-shift rotation role supporting the Supervisor and Specialists in Control Room Management functions.
 As an active Utility Controller, also take on the role as the On-Call Gas Control Unit Leader for Emergency Response and On Call Controller requests.



   Who You Are
 

   Required:
 

 Related technical diploma and a minimum of 1-year direct experience as a Control Centre Operator, or equivalent mix of education and experience



   Preferred:
 

 3+ years of major pipeline experience.
 Technical College Diploma in a Gas Industry Related field or a journeyman ticket in instrumentation, power engineering or a mechanical designation.
 Proven ability to work in high pressure environments.
 Able to work shiftwork.
 Significant understanding of SCADA systems and pipeline hydraulics.
 General understanding of major pipeline facilities, i.e., gas turbine compression, natural gas extraction, thermodynamic behavior of natural gases.



   Working Conditions
 

   Rotating shift schedule including weekends and nights with periodic overtime.
 


   12 hour shifts in a 24 X 7 operation scheduled with other Controllers in a Control Centre environment. Periodic project work supporting the Control Centre may be included in the shift schedule.
 


   This is a Safety Critical Role with live system monitoring and controlling activities that can directly impact the safety of others. Responsible for making operational decisions related to pressure, flow and quality of gas received from or delivered to Enbridge Gas’ interconnecting pipelines, in-franchise customers and storage.

   Are you looking to start your career in Finance? We are looking for an Analyst Cash Management & Banking to join our team! In this position you will be responsible for working on all aspects of banking administration, account openings and closings, tracking of bank fees, signatory management, coordinating web banking platforms and other services.
 


   What you will do
 



     Set-up enterprise wide cash management banking services including outsourced payment processing, tracking of bank fees, account openings/closings, authorized signatory updates and legal KYC documentation for all entities.
   


     Provide System Administration for our key cash management system (Kyriba) and for all web banking applications, including user support and training.
   


     Work closely with cash management banks on detailed requirements for bank accounts, new cash management services, and problem resolution.
   


     Coordinate with various business units to understand and implement their banking requirements, support their day-to-day banking needs including problem solving (directly or with assistance from the bank) in a very timely and professional manner.
   


     Review and Validate Treasury (Openlink) transactions for all daily funding, investing and any intercompany transactions. Ensure such transactions have proper backup, are accurately recorded, and are in accordance with established policies and procedures for internal control compliance.
   


     Assist with updating internal control and SOX process documentation & provide proper evidence for all transactional testing samples required by internal & external auditors.
   


     Coordinate year-end external Audit confirmations.
   


     Work independently on Treasury related projects as the need arises.
   



   Who you are
 

   You have the following qualifications and skills:
 



     University Degree (Financial orientation preferred).
   


     0-2 years of progressive experience in Finance (Treasury) related field.
   


     Completion or enrollment in a Business/Finance professional designation would be beneficial.
   


     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
   


     Strong organizational and time management skills with ability to handle several tasks, meet tight deadlines and complete assignments with a high degree of accuracy in a fast paced, dynamic and high-volume environment.
   


     Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and ability to work with multiple partners throughout the organization.
   


     Strong computer skills including the ability to quickly become proficient in the use and optimization of Treasury systems (Kyriba, Openlink, various web banking platforms).
   


     Oracle / SAP experience would be considered an asset.

   Are you passionate about sustainability and interested in revolutionizing the way businesses and individuals adopt cleaner energy solutions? 
  
   Enbridge Sustain
  , a leading provider in the energy industry, is seeking an exceptionally talented & analytical sales reporting & analytics lead to join our rapidly growing team.
 


   As we are laying down the foundation for our innovative venture, you will have a crucial role to play in the overall growth and success of the team. As a lead, you will be the architect and ultimate leader of all reporting and analytics for Enbridge Sustain, empowering the team with valuable data and insights that drive improvements in performance, strategy, and customer growth.
 


   Are you someone who is highly enthusiastic & possess a can-do entrepreneurial mindset? Are you a leader that is also not afraid to roll up their sleeves while the team grows out? Are you a passionate storyteller who can paint a picture for non-technical stakeholders that conveys complex data insights clearly and in a meaningful way? If the answers are yes, we’d love to hear from you!
 


   RE-POST
 


   What you will do:
 



     Spearhead sales reporting and analytics for the team and the executive leadership to establish & maintain a comprehensive reporting framework ground up.
   


     Taking ownership of creating and maintaining real-time sales forecasts to support the business goals and objectives.
   


     Utilizing data to identify trends and patterns in customer behavior, product preferences, and sales cycles; and recommend ideas to meet the need of potential Enbridge Sustain customers.
   


     Being a trusted advisor to the leadership team in tracking key performance indicators such as revenue, capital generated, conversion rates, breakage, project information, and more.
   


     Analyze and provide visibility on sales pipeline including but not limited to health of on-going deals, forecasting future revenues, potential bottlenecks, and the likelihood of closing.
   


     Provide system recommendations to the product development team for the building of necessary systems to support sales and marketing organization, including but not limited to CRM and leads management tools.
   


     Develop executive-level presentations, reports and insights for a quick read/synopsis on the health of the business and identify actions or corrective measures that are required to succeed.
   


     Eventually build out a team that will support the above and advance the reporting and analytical abilities to support Enbridge Sustain group.
   



   Who you are:
 



     You have a bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Marketing, or related discipline.
   


     Progressive 7-10 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or similar work experience, with a minimum of 5 years in a sales environment.
   


     You are highly skilled at data analysis tools and techniques, such as MS Excel, data visualization tools such as Tableau, power BI and statistical methods.
   


     You are a skilled storyteller who enjoys presenting through PowerPoint and/or Word.
   


     You will create and then lead the sales forecasting process for the team.
   


     You have a strong understanding of the sales space; not limited to sales processes, sales terminology, and market dynamics to help contextualizing data and identify trends or opportunities.
   


     You have experience identifying issues and challenges within sales data and developing data driven solutions to address them.
   


     You are a proven manager of people, able to motivate a team to deliver best in class sales reporting and forecasting.
   



   What is Enbridge Sustain? With over 175 years of energy industry experience, we understand the importance of reducing emissions, improving energy efficiency, and strengthening resilience in the face of changing climate and rising energy costs. Our aim is simple: make it easier and more affordable for customers to embrace sustainable energy alternatives, while contributing to a greener future. Enbridge Sustain will offer customers an end-to-end solution, from design and installation to maintenance and support, eliminating the complexities and challenges associated with conventional heating and cooling equipment.

   Do you have strong analytical skills and enjoy problem solving? If so, we are currently looking for a Maintenance Technician (Mechanical) in our Prairie Lakes Region (Alliance) within Enbridge Gas Transmission who will be responsible to apply their skills, experiences, and aptitude to repair, install, troubleshoot, and perform other planned maintenance and corrective tasks on assigned mechanical equipment, devices, and auxiliary systems. If you enjoy a faced-paced environment, then this role is for you!
 


   We are looking to add an individual to our team who shares in our core values of safety, integrity, respect, and inclusion! In return, we offer opportunities to grow and increase your knowledge and skills, in an exciting career filled with a competitive benefits and pension package including generous time off.
 


   What you will do:
 



     Operate and maintain compressor stations, pipeline, and right-of-way as well as mainline block valve sites.
   


     Ensure facilities and personnel comply with Enbridge safety, health, environment, and risk standards.
   




     Fosters high standards in these areas and models’ safe behavior based on safety principles.
   




     Responsible for regulatory compliance, operations, maintenance, and repair procedures as associated with Regulatory requirements, industry standards and company guidelines as they relate to facility equipment and appurtenances.
   


     Responsible for recognition and reporting of abnormal and safety related operating conditions including accident and near miss reporting as well as emergency response involvement at all levels. Safe work permitting and contract management during maintenance activities.
   


     Manage of workflow using SAP which includes identifying, planning, procurement of parts, execution of tasks, completion of work orders as required.
   


     Planning of area maintenance schedules, work backlog management, budget control, involvement in environment, safety, and technical optimization initiatives as well as the individual management of all required training, including regulatory and technical.
   


     Adheres to Enbridge gas transmission (GTM) business and operational processes, procedures and practices and Enbridge Life Saving Rules.
   


     This position will be expected to be on call for operations on a rotational basis for the facilities in the area and respond to the system emergencies/unplanned outages.
   


     Undergo various background screening that includes but is not limited to 5-year driving record, criminal check and a company sponsored medical and drug testing.
   



   Who you are:
 



     High School Diploma or GED equivalent with Mechanical/Millwright Journeyperson status and typically 2 years of directly relevant training and experience OR enrolled in their 4th year of the apprenticeship program.
   


     Other mechanical experience/attributes or trades may be considered.
   


     Experience and knowledge of compressor station operations and high-pressure gas transmission.
   


     Highly motivated with interpersonal skills to effectively work in a collaborative team environment that includes shared responsibilities, establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with others, support team and company objectives, and a willingness to work in all areas required by the team.
   


     Proficient in navigating software systems and in using Microsoft applications.
   


     Experience with Maximo or SAP is an asset.
   



   Working Conditions:
 



     Field environment with 4/10hr shifts.
   


     Working conditions at times involve working in adverse weather, working within high noise level areas, and working from heights.
   


     Travel - through the Saskatchewan operating area.
   


     On-call rotation and Emergency support.

   Apply today to this excellent opportunity on our diverse team! #joinourteam
 


This is a temporary assignment for approximately one year duration.

     Responsible to plan, assign and monitor efforts to maintain a comprehensive internal control framework and system of internal controls for assigned areas.

     Drive key work including, the identification, development, documentation and maintenance of internal controls over the processes that impact financial reporting for assigned areas.

Job Description:
Work options: Hybrid
 

 1 Year Contract
 Hybrid: 500 Consumers Rd, North York, Ontario, M2J 1P8


 At Enbridge, our goal is to be the first-choice energy delivery company in North America and beyond—for customers, communities, investors, regulators and policymakers, and employees.
 To meet that goal, Enbridge is partnering with Raise—a leading recruitment firm that specializes in IT, Technical, and Engineering staffing.
 Together, Raise and Enbridge are building teams that are rising to meet the growing energy needs of North America. If you’re looking for a challenging role that will make the most of your skills while allowing you to make an impact, this is it.
 Enbridge is hiring an Advisor, Energy Solutions right now—when you apply, Raise will review your application within 48 hours and contact qualified applicants for interviews.

 Key Responsibilities:
 Proactive outreach to assigned accounts; conduct site visits and facility walk-throughs to assist customers with the identification, business screening and technical evaluation of potential energy conservation opportunities.

 Drive energy conservation participation by assisting and influencing customers. Develop high-level business justification cases to help customers make decisions to proceed with projects.
 Establish alliances with business partners (contractors, equipment suppliers and manufacturers, consulting engineers, etc.) and affiliated Associations to facilitate the development and implementation of energy efficiency projects.
 Provide timely submission of projects and customer relationship data into tracking systems to ensure all completed projects are verifiable and capable of withstanding the audit and verification process.
 Complete accurate and timely outlooks and forecasts for current year energy conservation delivery results. Establish and build customer relationships with the goal of long-term trust and dedication to achieve natural gas reduction targets.
 Attend customer meetings, applicable trade shows and energy forums and events and present energy efficiency programs. Promoting energy conservation and representing the Enbridge brand.
 Provide market intelligence and insights to assist in the adjustment to current program offerings and the development future energy conservation program to serve the market.
 Stay informed of technical advancements and changes relative to industry through continued education, certification, and training opportunities.


 Criteria & Qualifications

 Related university degree (preferably in Business, Engineering) and 4+ years of related experience.
 Seasoned sales professional with account management experience
 Demonstrated ability in project engineering, technical sales, or project management in • Technical and analytical proficiency, with time management skills to look after ongoing contending priorities.
 Self-motivated, self-starter, able to operate independently but work with a team of like-minded professionals.
 Customer and results focused along with great interpersonal skills.
 Proven skills in leading and influencing without explicit authority.
 The ability to co-ordinate multiple projects while handling personal time.
 Outstanding written and verbal communication ability and excellent listening skills.
 Strong relationship building, problem solving skills and negotiation skills.
 Passion for upholding Enbridge's core values of Safety, Integrity, Respect, and Inclusion along with our ways of working.

 Preferred Skills

 Certified Energy Manager
 Membership in Professional Engineers of Ontario or similar professional organization

 Working Conditions

 Regular visits to customer facilities and job sites to assess energy efficiency opportunities on weekly basis.
 Travel, including overnight, mainly within Ontario, is required.
 Valid G License and responsible Driver's record is needed.

     Work with internal and external partners to determine project scope including SCADA, communication networks and telecom systems.

     Provide guidance on wind, solar and battery storage systems during initial and commissioning phases of each project.
   


     Engage in project-related technical communication with engineers and contractors to ensure seamless integration of data and remote access to project sites.
   


     Define system configuration, equipment selection and design features in compliance with site-specific needs of Enbridge, utilities, ISO’s and regional reliability council requirements.

     Professional designation (P.Eng. or PE) with experience with SCADA and power plant control systems, data acquisition and telecommunications required. An equivalent combination of experience and education will also be considered.
   


     Field Experience in testing/commissioning and/or telecommunications is a plus.
   


     Knowledge of PLCs, RTUs, and communication hardware for power and control systems using standard communication protocols (e.g., DNP, MODBUS, OPC, ICCP, etc.) is preferred.
   


     Proven knowledge and understanding of the regulatory requirements and industry standards for renewable energy Generation projects.

   Are you a top tier and passionate strategist ready to provide recommendations on fundamental analysis and strategic directions to the Liquids Pipelines leadership team? We are looking for a Specialist, LP Strategy to join our team!
 


   In this role you support the development, and assist in the coordination, of LP’s short and long-term business strategy through research, development of strategic thought, financial and competitive analysis, and capturing input from resources within LP and Enbridge.
 


   If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply today!
 


   What You Will Do:
 



     Assist in the development of the LP section of the annual Board strategic planning session and the resulting final LP materials for Enbridge day, in collaboration with Investor relations.
   


     Work with LP BD and Commercial groups, along with Corporate Strategy & Fundamentals and New Energies, to develop & evaluate strategic alternatives by framing strategy discussions, finding opportunities, threats and signposts, completing competitive & customer analysis, and evaluating LP’s relative strengths & weaknesses.
   


     Develop long-term financial asset models to evaluate different long term strategy & optimization alternatives; involves working closely with the Finance group, with input & direction from Commercial and Operations & Engineering groups.
   


     Develop, coordinate, review and finalize all LP materials for Executive Leadership, CEO, Board Level and external meetings.
   


     Multi-level leadership and employee engagement (including helping coordinate strategic information sessions and leadership conferences) to collect, synthesize, and implement input into the long-term strategic plan.
   


     Work closely with all groups within LP and capture, prioritize and supervise progress of key goals and objectives for the current year to support success vs scorecard metrics.
   



   Who You Are:
 

   Required:
 



     University Degree(s) in Business, or Engineering (or applicable field) from a relevant undergraduate program with a preference for an MBA.
   


     10+ years of dynamically responsible and validated experience in energy, energy consulting / finance, commercial or strategy.
   


     Good understanding of Liquids Pipelines and ideally Market Fundamentals, Customers/Competitors, Strategic Planning, Corporate Development and Investor Relations.
   


     Significant experience with conducting both qualitative and quantitative analysis, including research.
   


     Strong ability to conceptually frame, develop insights and address problems.
   


     Excellent written and verbal communication skills; able to build a clear narrative.
   


     Sophisticated knowledge of MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint and Word).
   



   Preferred:
 



     Highly beneficial to have knowledge of finance and financial modeling.
   


     Base-level understanding of emissions, decarbonization strategies, and new energies would be helpful, but not required.

   Enbridge is looking for a Sr Specialist Project Manager who will manage Wind Power projects, through the project life cycle, using best in class project management standards and practices. This role will be responsible for delivering safe and successful wind projects, that meet the business’ needs and priorities. This will involve acquiring and leading multidisciplinary teams of contractors and consultants, and leading large functional project teams to meet market competitive project timelines and objectives, while ensuring projects are within approved project budgets, schedules and scope. Does this sound exciting? Read on! #topemployer
 


   We offer opportunities for growth, a competitive benefits and pension plan, and generous time off. Apply today, we'd love to hear from you! #joinourteam
 


   Note: Internally this role is referred to as Sr Specialist Project Management.
 


   What You Will Do:
 



     Accountable for all aspects of assigned power project(s) including detailed design, long lead procurement, construction, compliance, integration, safety, cost, schedule, and quality.
   


     Lead functional project teams by ensuring they are staffed, have role clarity and are capable to meet the challenges and objectives of each project and removing barriers to success.
   


     Actively collaborate in project development with strong value-added engagement in up-front planning, generating achievable goals supporting “best in class” top quartile results.
   


     Owning and ensuring the efficacious use of strong and disciplined project management systems and practices to manage and report on project status, proactively escalating issues as needed.
   


     Assure implementation of construction management processes and procedures (specifications, inspection procedures, quality assurance program, materials management program, EH&S requirements, cost, progress, and schedule management, etc.).
   


     Innovate and drive value optimization through the full project lifecycle.
   


     Build trusting and strong relationships across the functional project organization, senior leadership, with key vendors and service providers, and the site construction team and ensure effective early engagement in decisions and plans that affect them.
   



   Who You Are:
 



     A University degree in Engineering or related construction or operational training and/or experience will be considered.
   


     10+ years of progressively increasing project technical and leadership experience is highly desirable with a strong site and office background, with wind project execution hands-on leadership experience in the Project Manager (or combination of Project Manager, Sr. Project Engineer and/or site Construction Manager) role on multiple on-shore wind projects exceeding 100MW of generation capacity.
   


     Expertise in project management methods and techniques, with preference for PMP certification or equivalent.
   


     Strong leadership and management, including organizational and planning skills.
   


     Collaborative leader, who efficiently leads and inspires teams to exceed expectations.
   


     A creative and logical thinker, with strong decision making skills
   


     Lead meetings and set expectations for project team and stakeholders.
   


     Successfully negotiate win-win solutions with both internal and external stakeholders.
   


     Predict and find issues and potential risks before they arise and implement plans to manage.
   


     Taking immediate and independent action to resolve issues or problems when they arise.
   


     Conveying a strong sense of urgency and driving issues to closure.
   


     Passion for upholding Enbridge's core values of Safety, Integrity, Respect, Inclusion and High Performance along with our ways of working.
   



   Preferred Skills:
 

   Registered as a PE (US) or P.Eng. (Canada).
 


   Working Conditions:
 

   Office environment with frequent travel to field locations (~20-30%) and Company offices. A valid license and responsible driving record is mandatory.
 

   This role would involve some cross-border travel to the US.

 Accountable for managing scope, schedule, cost, quality, and risks of an assigned project to assure its successful delivery.

 Show experience working with Operations teams and are able to read engineering drawing and materials reports
 Show planning skills as well as strong abilities in problem solving, decision making and organization


   You are:
 

 An excellent written and verbal communicator
 A motivated self-starter who works well independently in a fast-paced environment
 Proficient with and have working knowledge of the MS Office Suite

 PMP Certification or equivalent

   Do you have strong analytical skills and enjoy problem solving? If so, we are currently looking for a Maintenance Technician (Mechanical) in our Prairie Lakes Region (Alliance) within Enbridge Gas Transmission who will be responsible to apply their skills, experiences, and aptitude to repair, install, troubleshoot, and perform other planned maintenance and corrective tasks on assigned mechanical equipment, devices, and auxiliary systems.    We are looking to add an individual to our team who shares in our core values of safety, integrity, respect, and inclusion! In return, we offer opportunities to grow and increase your knowledge and skills, in an exciting career filled with a competitive benefits and pension package including generous time off.
 


   What you will do:
 



     Operate and maintain compressor stations, pipeline, and right-of-way as well as mainline block valve sites.
   


     Ensure facilities and personnel comply with Enbridge safety, health, environment, and risk standards.
   




     Fosters high standards in these areas and models’ safe behavior based on safety principles.
   




     Responsible for regulatory compliance, operations, maintenance, and repair procedures as associated with Regulatory requirements, industry standards and company guidelines as they relate to facility equipment and appurtenances.

     Manage of workflow using SAP which includes identifying, planning, procurement of parts, execution of tasks, completion of work orders as required.
   


     Planning of area maintenance schedules, work backlog management, budget control, involvement in environment, safety, and technical optimization initiatives as well as the individual management of all required training, including regulatory and technical.

     Highly motivated with interpersonal skills to effectively work in a collaborative team environment that includes shared responsibilities, establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with others, support team and company objectives, and a willingness to work in all areas required by the team.
   


     Proficient in navigating software systems and in using Microsoft applications.
   


     Experience with Maximo or SAP is an asset.

     Field environment with 4/10hr shifts.
   


     Working conditions at times involve working in adverse weather, working within high noise level areas, and working from heights.

     On-call rotation and Emergency support.

   Are you someone who thrives in a fast-paced, innovative environment? If so, we are seeking a Supervisor Turnover and Integration who will play a pivotal role in coordinating the integration and divestiture of asset information, guaranteeing seamless transitions and maximizing resource utilization. In addition to acting as a central link between internal stakeholders, facilitating smooth information exchange and collaboration, the Supervisor establishes and enhances processes for efficient information (drawings, records, surveys, and asset specification data) turnover. If this is you come join the Enbridge family, apply today!
 


   We are looking to add an individual to our diverse team who shares in our core values of safety, integrity, respect, and inclusion! In return, we offer opportunities to grow and increase your knowledge and skills, and an exciting career filled with a competitive benefits and pension package including generous time off.
 


   What You Will Do:
 

 Own the development and implementation of clear and efficient processes and procedures for the turnover and control of information, ensuring consistency and compliance throughout the lifecycle of the project.
 Accountable to design comprehensive metrics to evaluate the quality and efficiency of information turnover, enabling data-driven decision-making and continuous improvement efforts.
 Collaborate with various stakeholders, including projects, operations, and engineering teams, to facilitate seamless information exchange and collaboration.
 Ensure seamless integration of assets by meticulously verifying data and information compliance with company standards, while also updating and transforming data as necessary to meet LP requirements. Additionally, oversee the migration of information into Meridian, guaranteeing accessibility for stakeholders while adhering to established standards and protocols.
 Accountable for the divestiture of asset information, including the identification of assets within scope, gathering pertinent information from various sources, collaborating with business development to fulfill customer information requests, and managing the necessary changes to drawings and records in existing information systems.

 Handle information search requests, utilizing expertise to efficiently retrieve and provide relevant data as required by internal stakeholders.
 Collaborate with Technology Information Systems (TIS) Team on Meridian System Administration tasks, including system upgrades and resolving issues promptly, ensuring the seamless operation of the system.
 Perform rigorous project gating reviews from an Asset Information Management perspective, offering insightful recommendations for project gating sign-off, contributing to informed decision-making processes within the organization.

   Required:
 

 University Degree in Business or related degree; Minimum of 10 years of professional experience with demonstrable leadership experience.
 Experience working with Engineering Drawings and Records, and Information Management Systems.
 Excellent communication skills and the ability to interface with Projects, Operations, and other technical subject matter experts.
 Exhibits great interpersonal skills and works effectively in a team environment.
 Effective organizational and time management skills in handling multiple projects, performing a variety of tasks, and meeting required deadlines.
 Requires strong customer service focus and ability to maintain effective working relationships with broad base of engineering drawing users and editors.

 Completion of an Engineering or related degree considered an asset

Position: Developer IV ( Hybrid: Edmonton, AB) - Remote
Job Description:
Work options: Hybrid
 

 1 Year Contract
 Hybrid: 10175 101st NW, Edmonton, Alberta, T5J 0H3


 At Enbridge, our goal is to be the first-choice energy delivery company in North America and beyond—for customers, communities, investors, regulators and policymakers, and employees.
 To meet that goal, Enbridge is partnering with Raise—a leading recruitment firm that specializes in IT, Technical, and Engineering staffing.
 Together, Raise and Enbridge are building teams that are rising to meet the growing energy needs of North America. If you’re looking for a challenging role that will make the most of your skills while allowing you to make an impact, this is it.
 Enbridge is hiring a Developer right now—when you apply, Raise will review your application within 48 hours and contact qualified applicants for interviews.

 Primary Focus
 To Enhance Enbridge Pipeline Control, Leak Detection and SCADA systems in support of Control Centre Operations and related business areas. The primary focus of this role is on:

 Deliver quality software products and services and to satisfy the business needs of the client business units, within the specified time and budget.
 Work with staff from other areas for the overall benefit of Pipeline Control Systems & Leak Detection (PCSLD) and Enbridge.
 Manage and resolve client issues for defined business areas.
 Maintain and enhance existing Pipeline Control & Leak Detection products and technologies.


 Specific Accountabilities

 Participate in development and testing of new products and/or functional enhancements to existing products, and their implementation into the SCADA and/or Leak Detection systems.
 Provide technical support, troubleshooting, problem diagnosis, application testing and configuration changes, as a member of the team which takes ownership of custom-developed software products.
 Be responsive, supportive, and available to other PCSLD teams in support of Control Centre Operations and other business areas.
 Support SCADA Operations through the 7X24 call-out rotation during transition of Software Solutions projects, and any critical priority development support work.
 Demonstrate commitment to the Software Solutions team and its success.
 Demonstrate an understanding of Software Development best practices, standards, and operating procedures as applicable to mission critical, SCADA and Leak Detection software development.
 Perform code reviews on developers of all experience levels, with the ability to give and take constructive feedback.
 Prepare and maintain documentation as per Enbridge standards.
 Deliver customer requirements with consideration to overall corporate strategy.
 Participate in the Enbridge Health and Safety program.


 Scope

 Involvement in design/code reviews and technology investigations required for projects involving the Software Solutions Team.
 Design, develop, and implement SCADA and/or Leak Detection applications/products.
 Provide input and feedback on the team’s Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and quality processes to ensure continuous improvement within the team.
 Regular communication with project managers and/or Supervisor as defined by each project’s communication plan.
 Failure to deliver on high priority initiatives has potential to impact overall company performance or commitments to Enbridge customers.


 Contacts (Describe main contacts the job interacts with & the purpose & nature of the contacts)

 Directly reports to the Supervisor, Software Solutions.
 Consult with the PCSLD Lead Architect and the Architecture Review Team regarding use/approval of new technologies, applications, and enterprise technology direction.
 Work directly with Software Solutions project agile team and PCSLD projects with related scopes to Software Solutions.


 Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
 (Describe the education, experience and skills required to perform this job).

 Relevant degree / diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related discipline.
 Seven or more years of work experience.
 Strong industry expertise in C#, Python and/or Java with an excellent track record of designing and implementing complex system software. Direct experience with SCADA and Leak Detection software applications is considered an asset.
 Some knowledge and experience in SCADA, communication protocols, PLC/RTU/DCS data driver development and both historical and real-time data access methodologies.
 Working knowledge of Unix and/or Linux and Windows operating systems.
 Ability to provide technical leadership to junior staff.
 Strong analytical communications and problems solving skills.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including good presentation skills and ability to write technical documents/specifications.
 Sound organizational skills. Able to handle multiple tasks and multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, priority-changing environment.


 Please note: Successful applicants will be employees of Raise, working at Enbridge facilities with both Enbridge and contract employees.

 Applying with Raise
 Raise is an established IT and engineering hiring firm with over 60 years’ experience connecting talented candidates with meaningful work. When you apply, you’ll get more than just a chance at a great job—you’ll become part of a vast network of employers that are always changing.
 We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us at +1 800-567-9675 or hello@raiserecruiting.com

   Are you a financial planning and analysis (FP&A) professional with the ability to communicate and create positive relationships through all levels of an organization? We are looking for a Sr Advisor, FP&A - Downstream who will be responsible for creation of the financial Strategic Plan, Budgets and Forecasts for the Downstream entities and JVs, BD, and LP special projects providing concise, relevant supporting analysis and presentation materials to support the Asset Manager and Senior Management review and evaluation.
 


   We offer opportunities for growth, a competitive benefits and pension plan, and generous time off. We'd love to hear from you! Apply today to this excellent opportunity with us.
 


   What you will do:
 



     Develops analysis and presentation materials for Sr Management evaluation that are succinct and understandable, identify the priority issues, risks, and opportunities in support of Management decision making.
   


     Establishes and maintains financial models ensuring accuracy, documented compliance with shipper agreements, relevancy (i.e., models kept current – no redundancy), auditability, adherence to accounting’s spreadsheet conventions.
   


     Proactive and effective relationship maintained with respective Asset Manager, ensuring results are validated and providing financial advice.
   


     Maintains current knowledge of the respective shipper agreements financial terms and conditions through preparing, updating, or reviewing agreement synopsis of accounting terms and requirements.
   


     Liaises with and maintains strong and open communications with the various assumption input providers to the financial modeling processes.
   


     Prepares forecast for working capital, TSA deficiency calculations to support the JV distributions.
   


     Reviews management reporting documents

   Gazifère, le distributeur exclusif de gaz naturel en Outaouais et une entreprise dynamique et en forte croissance, est à la recherche d’un Répartiteur.
 


   Les répartiteurs jouent un rôle clé chez Gazifère. Ils sont principalement responsables de répartir les appels de services, de s’assurer du suivi des travaux, de partager l’information des archives et de s’assurer de la bonne coordination des situations d’urgences.
 


   Si vous êtes axé sur les détails, avez d’excellentes compétences en communication et en relations interpersonnelles, postulez dès aujourd’hui!
 


   Remarque : Comme nous recherchons fréquemment des candidat(e)s qualifié(e)s pour nos postes de Répartiteur, il s'agit d'un appel d'offres ouvert pour la région de Gatineau, au Québec. Au fur et à mesure que des postes se présenteront pour ces rôles, nous communiquerons avec les candidat(e)s qualifié(e)s.
 


   Qui sommes-nous?
 

   Notre objectif est de fournir une énergie sûre et fiable qui contribue à la qualité de vie des personnes. Nous alimentons les besoins énergétiques des gens, nécessaires à leur chauffage domestique, à leur éclairage, à leurs déplacements et à leur connectivité.
 


   Nous accueillons les nouveaux membres au sein d'une équipe où tout le monde s'engage à s'entraider afin d'accomplir le travail tout en se sentant valorisé et apprécié. Nous sommes guidés par nos valeurs de sécurité, d'intégrité, de respect et d'inclusion. Ces valeurs nous aident à établir une relation de confiance avec nos employés, nos abonnés et les collectivités que nous desservons dans toute la région de l'Outaouais. Nous soutenons fermement les collectivités dans lesquelles nous vivons et travaillons, en leur donnant en retour et en contribuant à leur force et à leur vitalité.
 


   Êtes-vous intéressé(e) à explorer cette possibilité au sein de Gazifère? Nous aimerions savoir ce que vous en pensez. Posez votre candidature dès aujourd'hui!
 


   Un aperçu de votre quart de travail (vos responsabilités)
 



     Répondre de manière professionnelle aux appels de service et d’urgence de la clientèle
   


     Écouter et évaluer les besoins du client, et assurer les suivis requis selon les demandes
   


     Compléter l’entrée de données relatives aux appels de service et d’urgence
   


     Répartir, émettre et contrôler les demandes de service destinées aux équipes des opérations, aux localisateurs et à l’entrepreneur de service, et, investiguer sur certains de ces appels au besoin
   


     Effectuer diverses tâches administratives
   


     Composer avec différents systèmes informatiques
   


     Agir à titre de référence pour les demandes provenant des représentants du service à la clientèle
   



   Vous êtes la personne que nous cherchons si vous avez à offrir (vos qualifications)
 



     Du bilinguisme. La personne dans ce poste doit maîtriser le français. Comme cette personne devra interagir fréquemment avec des collègues, intervenants et clients qui ne parlent pas le français, il est donc exigé que cette personne possède une bonne connaissance de la langue anglaise, tant à l’orale qu’à l’écrit.
   


     Un diplôme d’études secondaires complété
   


     La capacité de travailler sous pression avec un minimum de supervision, et de gérer les priorités et le stress
   


     D’excellentes compétences organisationnelles vous permettant d’exécuter plusieurs tâches à la fois tout en établissant et respectant vos priorités
   


     D’impeccable compétences de communication et d’écoute
   


     Du dynamisme, de l’initiative, et de la débrouillardise
   


     Une bonne maîtrise des outils informatiques
   


     Expérience de répartition antérieure serait un atout
   


 Conditions de travail
   Il existe différents horaires de quarts de travail pour nos rôles de Répartiteur
 



     Quart de jour (x2): 35h/semaine, 7h à 15h et 9h à 17h

   Are you a credible professional in tax compliance and accounting? If so, we are looking for you! The Sr Advisor Tax Reporting carries out tasks within the income tax reporting function for assigned entities within the Calgary Tax Services Department. It includes compliance, budget & forecasting for taxes, financial reporting for taxes, tax authority audit support and research.
 


   We offer opportunities for career development, growing your knowledge and skills, and an exciting career with competitive benefits and pension package including generous time off.
 


   Apply today to this excellent opportunity on our diverse team! #joinourteam
 


   What You Will Do:
 



     Responsible for carrying out the income tax compliance function for assigned entities within the Calgary Tax Services Department. The income tax compliance function includes research as well as meeting compliance requirements on a timely and accurate basis. This includes the preparation of federal and provincial income tax returns including, but not limited to, partnership returns, trust returns, foreign affiliate and other non-resident forms. It also includes maintaining current calculations of adjusted cost base and surplus accounts.
   


     Responsible for carrying out the financial reporting for taxes function for assigned entities within the Calgary Tax Services Department. This includes tax accounting research, computation of taxes and drafting of tax disclosures on a quarterly and annual basis. It also lends support to the consolidation team within the tax services department.
   


     Responsible for carrying out budget and forecasting of taxes for assigned entities within the Calgary Tax Services Department.
   


     Supports the Tax Authority Audit function for assigned entities within the Calgary Tax Serviced Department. This includes drafting replies to audit queries and proposed reassessments as well as staying abreast of changes in CRA administrative positions and audit practices.
   


     Provides Ad hoc income tax advice within the Calgary Tax Services Department as well as to other internal stakeholders such as the Controllers, Treasury, Business Development and Legal.
   


     Carries out income tax research as assigned and prepares written memorandums to document and support conclusions.
   


     Responsible for monitoring changes in tax legislation, jurisprudences, assessing policies and changes in tax accounting standards and communicate such changes on a timely basis. Prepares monthly presentation of such changes for discussion at monthly Tax Department meeting.
   


     Mentor and coach junior members within the Income Tax Reporting group, including review of their work
   


     Participates and prepares internally developed training programs and makes a commitment to continuous development of income tax and tax accounting skills.
   


     Contributes to the positive team environment of the Calgary Tax Services Department.
   


     Develops and maintains a strong understanding of the business.
   



   Who You Are:
 

   Required:
 



     University graduate of Business Administration or other related discipline
   


     Accounting designation (CPA CA, CPA CGA, or CPA CMA)
   


     6+ years of proven experience in income tax (with focus on tax returns and income tax provisions)
   


     Completion of the CPA In-depth tax course preferred but not required
   


     Demonstrated leadership and teamwork skills
   


     Proficiency with Corporate Taxprep
   


     Proficiency with PowerBI/Power Query functions and processes
   


     Proficiency with accounting software (Oracle, HFM/Smartview)
   


     Proficiency with tax provision software (OTP)
   


     Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel).
   


     Strong written and oral communication skills.
   



   Working Conditions:
 



     This role operates within a fast-paced environment and requires the ability to organize, prioritize and manage multiple projects and work assignments on an ongoing and continuous basis.
   


     This role requires significant communication among various internal departments, business units and external parties
   


     Office environment. Occasional travel.

 At Enbridge, our goal is to be the first-choice energy delivery company in North America and beyond—for customers, communities, investors, regulators and policymakers, and employees.

 Enbridge is hiring an Oversight Electrical Technologist Senior right now—when you apply, Raise will review your application within 48 hours and contact qualified applicants for interviews.

 Job Description:
 The Electrical Technologist is responsible for design or design oversight of all electrical equipment and systems required by the project they are assigned to. Confirms cable and conduit/cable tray schedules are complete and accurate. Confirms cable schedule are using cable types consistently to avoid unnecessary variations and checks for code and specification compliance. Confirms format of schedule is consistent with other projects and spot checks for code compliance.

 Key Responsibilities:

 Assist the Project Development group in establishing the engineering design scope of project & DBM.
 Provides oversight on discipline specific design (sometimes at ESP office) quality & progress.
 Reports issues of concern back to Lead Oversight Engineer.
 Facilitates the necessary engineering information needed by Project Manager to submit regulatory applications.
 Assist in the procurement process; reviewing equipment spec sheets, technical bid reviews shop visits and inspections.
 Monitors discipline specific deliverable quality and schedule.
 Monitors ESP's adherence to their quality program.
 Looks to optimize the design through Value Improving Practices - process simplification, design to capacity, value engineering and RAM studies (Reliability, Availability & Maintainability)
 Participates in HAZOP and other Hazard reviews.
 Liaisons with other functional Business Unit departments; Operations, SCADA, Regulatory, Environmental, Process Safety, Health & Safety, Lands, Stakeholder Relations, Measurement & Allocations and Communications.


 Qualifications: 

Electrical Technologist Diploma or equivalent experience
 10+ years experience in a related field

   Are you a top tier and passionate strategist ready to provide recommendations on fundamental analysis and strategic directions to the Liquids Pipelines leadership team? We are looking for a Specialist, LP Strategy to join our team!
 


   In this role you support the development, and assist in the coordination, of LP’s short and long-term business strategy through research, development of strategic thought, financial and competitive analysis, and capturing input from resources within LP and Enbridge.
 


   If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply today!
 


   What You Will Do:
 



     Assist in the development of the LP section of the annual Board strategic planning session and the resulting final LP materials for Enbridge day, in collaboration with Investor relations.
   


     Work with LP BD and Commercial groups, along with Corporate Strategy & Fundamentals and New Energies, to develop & evaluate strategic alternatives by framing strategy discussions, finding opportunities, threats and signposts, completing competitive & customer analysis, and evaluating LP’s relative strengths & weaknesses.
   


     Develop long-term financial asset models to evaluate different long term strategy & optimization alternatives; involves working closely with the Finance group, with input & direction from Commercial and Operations & Engineering groups.
   


     Develop, coordinate, review and finalize all LP materials for Executive Leadership, CEO, Board Level and external meetings.
   


     Multi-level leadership and employee engagement (including helping coordinate strategic information sessions and leadership conferences) to collect, synthesize, and implement input into the long-term strategic plan.
   


     Work closely with all groups within LP and capture, prioritize and supervise progress of key goals and objectives for the current year to support success vs scorecard metrics.
   



   Who You Are:
 

   Required:
 



     University Degree(s) in Business, or Engineering (or applicable field) from a relevant undergraduate program with a preference for an MBA.
   


     10+ years of dynamically responsible and validated experience in energy, energy consulting / finance, commercial or strategy.
   


     Good understanding of Liquids Pipelines and ideally Market Fundamentals, Customers/Competitors, Strategic Planning, Corporate Development and Investor Relations.
   


     Significant experience with conducting both qualitative and quantitative analysis, including research.
   


     Strong ability to conceptually frame, develop insights and address problems.
   


     Excellent written and verbal communication skills; able to build a clear narrative.
   


     Sophisticated knowledge of MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint and Word).
   



   Preferred:
 



     Highly beneficial to have knowledge of finance and financial modeling.
   


     Base-level understanding of emissions, decarbonization strategies, and new energies would be helpful, but not required.

Does this sound exciting? Read on! #topemployer

     Accountable for all aspects of assigned power project(s) including detailed design, long lead procurement, construction, compliance, integration, safety, cost, schedule, and quality.

     Predict and find issues and potential risks before they arise and implement plans to manage.

Job Description:
Work options: Hybrid
 

 1 Year Contract
 Hybrid: 10175 101st NW, Edmonton, Alberta, T5J 0H3


 At Enbridge, our goal is to be the first-choice energy delivery company in North America and beyond—for customers, communities, investors, regulators and policymakers, and employees.
 To meet that goal, Enbridge is partnering with Raise—a leading recruitment firm that specializes in IT, Technical, and Engineering staffing.
 Together, Raise and Enbridge are building teams that are rising to meet the growing energy needs of North America. If you’re looking for a challenging role that will make the most of your skills while allowing you to make an impact, this is it.
 Enbridge is hiring a Developer right now—when you apply, Raise will review your application within 48 hours and contact qualified applicants for interviews.

 Primary Focus
 To Enhance Enbridge Pipeline Control, Leak Detection and SCADA systems in support of Control Centre Operations and related business areas. The primary focus of this role is on:

 Deliver quality software products and services and to satisfy the business needs of the client business units, within the specified time and budget.
 Work with staff from other areas for the overall benefit of Pipeline Control Systems & Leak Detection (PCSLD) and Enbridge.
 Manage and resolve client issues for defined business areas.
 Maintain and enhance existing Pipeline Control & Leak Detection products and technologies.


 Specific Accountabilities

 Participate in development and testing of new products and/or functional enhancements to existing products, and their implementation into the SCADA and/or Leak Detection systems.
 Provide technical support, troubleshooting, problem diagnosis, application testing and configuration changes, as a member of the team which takes ownership of custom-developed software products.
 Be responsive, supportive, and available to other PCSLD teams in support of Control Centre Operations and other business areas.
 Support SCADA Operations through the 7X24 call-out rotation during transition of Software Solutions projects, and any critical priority development support work.
 Demonstrate commitment to the Software Solutions team and its success.
 Demonstrate an understanding of Software Development best practices, standards, and operating procedures as applicable to mission critical, SCADA and Leak Detection software development.
 Perform code reviews on developers of all experience levels, with the ability to give and take constructive feedback.
 Prepare and maintain documentation as per Enbridge standards.
 Deliver customer requirements with consideration to overall corporate strategy.
 Participate in the Enbridge Health and Safety program.


 Scope

 Involvement in design/code reviews and technology investigations required for projects involving the Software Solutions Team.
 Design, develop, and implement SCADA and/or Leak Detection applications/products.
 Provide input and feedback on the team’s Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and quality processes to ensure continuous improvement within the team.
 Regular communication with project managers and/or Supervisor as defined by each project’s communication plan.
 Failure to deliver on high priority initiatives has potential to impact overall company performance or commitments to Enbridge customers.


 Contacts (Describe main contacts the job interacts with & the purpose & nature of the contacts)

 Directly reports to the Supervisor, Software Solutions.
 Consult with the PCSLD Lead Architect and the Architecture Review Team regarding use/approval of new technologies, applications, and enterprise technology direction.
 Work directly with Software Solutions project agile team and PCSLD projects with related scopes to Software Solutions.


 Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
 (Describe the education, experience and skills required to perform this job).

 Relevant degree / diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related discipline.
 Seven or more years of work experience.
 Strong industry expertise in C#, Python and/or Java with an excellent track record of designing and implementing complex system software. Direct experience with SCADA and Leak Detection software applications is considered an asset.
 Some knowledge and experience in SCADA, communication protocols, PLC/RTU/DCS data driver development and both historical and real-time data access methodologies.
 Working knowledge of Unix and/or Linux and Windows operating systems.
 Ability to provide technical leadership to junior staff.
 Strong analytical communications and problems solving skills.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including good presentation skills and ability to write technical documents/specifications.
 Sound organizational skills. Able to handle multiple tasks and multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, priority-changing environment.
